description:
Stopped in for a quick lunch and pleasantly surprised.

Freshly prepared food came out quickly and hot.

Prices for the lunch specials were good. I had the Chicken Curry which came with soup-everything was great.

Will probably be by to see them again when I'm next in town.

Good food and good value.
author: Gina C.

description:
The food at this place is seriously questionable. I ordered pork fried rice, sweet and sour chicken, pot stickers and chicken corn soup and not one single piece of the meat in any item tasted or resembled real meat. The flavor of everything is slightly off too. 

They got it to me quickly and that's why they got 2 stars instead of 1. Also no fortune cookie, Womp womp. 

I would never eat here again.
author: Danielle M.

description:
The food was okay, however they are not attentive to the tables.

Once they take your order and bring it out you're on your own  

I pretty much had to get up and get my own soda out of the fridge and no one came  not once to check in to see if everything was okay, in which more napkins and refills for water would have been greatly appreciated.
author: Javii C.

description: I just wanna let them know about the Mistake only today didn't wanna complain about that anything else. please make sure with your foods first before serve to the customer, I was very hungry in the morning, and would like to get best dim sum. I got shrimp dim sum first not cook well. I think it .. usual. Then I got the sui mai not cook well again What going on? Please make sure your foods please. Thx you so much.zzz
author: Satapol O.

description:
Ordered delivery due to it raining and being cold. I ordered the shrimp dumplings (3), the shrimp fried rice, and a chai tea. 
Everything was delicious! 
I knocked one star off due to my Thai tea leaking in my bag. I lost some of the deliciousness due to that spillage...
The delivery didn't take too long and the guy brought it up to my hotel room.
author: Joiya A.

description:
Three and a half stars, rounded up to four.

I order via Yelp and always put at least a 20% tip up front and my food arrives lightning-fast. I swear it came in 15 minutes once! That's what bumped my rating up to four stars.

Overall, the food is nothing to lose your mind over, but it's satisfying and tasty and the portions are good for the price.

My two favorites are the orange beef and the appetizer drumsticks. The orange beef kind of reminds me of jerky, in a good way. For this dish I like my meat chewy, and without a glopped-on coating. City Chopstick's version reminds me of how Hunan Homes on Jackson used to make it in the 90s, which is when I first tasted the dish and fell in love with the sweet/savory/chewy/slightly saucy combo.

The drumsticks deserve a star just for themselves. Damn, those things are crispy and meaty! I don't bother with the sauce because I want to enjoy the crunchy coating. BUT...you have to eat them as soon as they arrive. They don't do well when they cool off, or reheated as leftovers.

My kid loves the appetizer BBQ pork and the basic chow mein. She eats her fill and there's still plenty left for a robust snack the next day.

City Chopsticks is a sure thing for us on those nights when the fridge needs to be restocked but we want to eat NOW without spending a boatload of money. In other cases I usually tip cash, but here I recommend adding your (generous) tip to your online order...you'll see what a difference it makes when piping hot Chinese food shows up on your doorstep in less than 30 minutes!
author: Valeria R.

description: It is like any other chinese restaurant in downtown area. Decent if you want to grab cheap, quickly made and good tasting chinese food at the restaurant or to go. I've eaten there twice and there is usually not that many people in the restaurant but I see a lot of people ordering to-go or online.
author: Xi-Er D.

description:
Great food for the price. Living in sf, I know that everything is expensive. 
 Also it's been a few years now and I think I've seen a change in customer service. They smile, greet you and are courteous.
author: Megha P.

description:
Really good food!! Ordered to delivery and it took less than expected!!! 
Great price as well!! Definitely recommend!!!
author: Kika R.

description:
This chinese restaurant visit was very disappointing. The waiter did never refill our drinks or asked how the food was. In the end he brought us the recipe with the tip already included. 
Me and a friend each had a rice plate for 8.95$ and the total was almost 23$. 
The self written paper recipe didnt show the cost, taxes or the tip- only "the food"- 22,40. Ridiculous.
author: Claudia Z.

description:
And this is the worst service I've ever have in my entire life , I would absolutely just order to go because the service is just horrible .

To The only Asian male server:

DO NOT approach to your table saying ( You ready? On an aggressive way. I reply with a Hi . How are you? . And he still said you ready? . Am like am I talking to a robot ? .

DO NOT serve the alcohol beverage after 10min of being ordered . 

DO check if your table have knife or fork and napkins . I did not have any when the food arrived * .  I had to call some other lady for napkin and fork to start eating . 

Please find another job and stop ruining the restaurant business .
author: Simon B.

description: This is your average Chinese restaurant, it's not bad just particularly good either. We have tried several dishes on the menu and they are what you expect for the price. The service is also decent.
author: Mario T.

description: This use to be our go to Chinese takeout place due to its close proximity and the food being decent but after finding steel wool mixed in with the chow mein, we will not be ordering from here anymore.
author: Mynoi K.

description: The food and service is fast. But the mere quality of the food is "ehh." The House drumsticks were amazing! The fried rice was HORRIBLE! When I order fried rice I want my rice to be actually fried. Not white rice with the ingredients of fried rice. I'm not some skinny lil lady watching my figure and counting calories. Dump my rice in a wok SQUEEZE some oil in it and FRY MY SHIT! Add some soy sauce and the works! Why do I know how to do it and my Chinese/ Asian partners lack drastically in this area. (In Chinese on both sides btw). My fried rice should never look organic as does this one...
author: Sodro K.

description: I'm Chinese, so I tend to have high expectations for Chinese food. I ordered the Black Bean Beef Chow Fun and it was actually delicious! Super satisfying and filling. Portion style was good. Would definitely order here again!
author: Wendy D.

description: Bomb Chinese food, if you're into that kind of thing. I'm Usually hungover ordering curry shrimp fried rice, general Tsos and chicken w fresh veggies. Egg rolls and crab cheese wontons complete the feast.  Follow in my steps a you'll be glad you did.
author: c d.

description: It's ok good enough if you hungry but it's a bit pricy and just a bit small portions but still good
author: Jack M.

description: My favorite Chinese restaurant...all time, nd its not even in Chinatown. Always fresh and friendly, eat in or take out. Special treat whenever I'm in town.
author: Bil G.

description:
Came here for a very late lunch on Saturday starving after some exercise and ready to eat anything. The restaurant looks like a relatively clean Asian restaurant and the people that served us were very attentive, quiet and nice. I noticed a very interesting music playlist. One that would be considered lit in other contexts but not when it is elevator music volume in a Chinese restaurant in mid afernoon. 

I think we ordered and had a sip of beer when bam the food came out. So fast my first thought was whether we were too predictable and knew what we were going to order or I was drinking my beer too slowly. I don't think I was conserving my beer because the beers were cheap ($3.50 each for Tsing Tao, Sapporo, Heineken or Anchor Steam - get Sapporo!).

Here's what we ordered:

Potstickers ($5.95): 6 pieces of fried dumplings that had too much breading and did not taste good.

Bok Choy in Garlic Sauce ($9.45): Fresh tasting bok choy in a soupy sauce with nice garlic flavor.

General Tso's Chicken ($10.95): The general tso's chicken was fried well and was coated in a sweet tasty sauce but there was hardly any meat that I could taste no matter how large the pieces were. 

Mongolian Beef ($10.95): Tasty sliced beef wok fried with a lot of onions and scallions. I'll never say no to more onions and scallions because they can only add more to the flavor. But there wasn't enough beef and a heap of onions was what was left of the dish when we were done. 

Great service and decently clean restaurant but the food was below par and not filling (which is a first for me at a Chinese restaurant). Don't think I'll be coming back here.
author: Kyle R.

description:
We love the special noodle, it's so crunchy and delicious. The shrimp with broccoli was really really salty and the eggplant was salty and oily. 
The delivery person was really sweet and kind. 
I would order again.
author: Amal K.

description:
Fast service.  Ordered Ma Po Tofu, paid a few dollars extra for rice. The portions were big.  The Ma Po Tofu itself was pretty salty.  hot, and edible, but too salty for my taste.  The experience in the restaurant itself was ok, about what I expected.

The bad part came when ~9 hours after I ate the Ma Po Tofu from City Chopsticks, it all came back up. Felt sick for the rest of the night.  Food poisoning or just too greasy for me, I'm not sure.  Watch out!
author: Micah S.

description: The food was good enough. I guess I'm just not too impressed with the portion size. I'm not some glutenous potato, but if i'm going to pay an elevated price for lunch, I think it should be a plate of food that reflects that. Maybe I am a fatty. But I won't be coming back here for lunch based on portion.
author: Kat D.

description: Decent service and decent food but nothing really stands out in my opinion. Came here on a Monday night and found the restaurant half-empty. We ordered the eggplant, Mongolian beef, and chicken chow mien. Portions were smaller than I expected and the flavor was a bit lacking. I would have to say that there are definitely better Chinese restaurants in the city.
author: Allison T.

description:
Imagine over-battered, over-fried chicken in one container and lemon sauce in another. Let the chicken cool 15-minutes. Toss chicken in the lemon sauce and serve cold. That was my experience here, so needless to say I won't be returning for more delivery.

My whole order included lemon chicken, bok choy, and spring rolls. Nothing salvaged the overcooked chicken. I picked at my food for a few minutes and then it went to the fridge to die a second death.
author: Michelle L.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants to order delivery from they are quick and efficient. The shrimp asparagus is what I order it's delicious, simply amazing. I haven't been in person so I can't comment on that and I seriously order the same thing every time and can not say what the other food is like but I if you go simple with fried rice, chow mein or shrimp you should be good.
author: Demi W.

description: First time ordering here I don't usually order Chinese food but because they have a 92 health score I wanted to try them. I ordered the lunch General Tsuos chicken which came with rice and I ordered bok choy which came with a dead bug.. just my luck I get the bug after I was very skeptical about ordering togo Chinese food. Never ordering from here again. Thanks City Chopsticks for ruining my lunch
author: Lennie G.

description:
Grew up in an Asian town and this food is great. Salt and pepper pork chops were 10/10. Try something different than fried rice or fried noodles! 


Tip is included when you eat in, so make sure you look at your check and don't double tip!
author: Jimmy P.

description: Wow wow wow, Amazing..ly not good! I ordered the vegetable fried rice and short ribs. Sorry, fly lice as properly pronounced and yeah no. The worst short ribs ever. Leave it to Korea please! I flew from OC expecting great food everywhere and you really have to make all life decisions using yelp! I will say they had Backstreet Boys playing in the background so I can't completely say it was a horrible experience.
author: Meli M.

description:
I'd say 2.5 really, but I'll be generous and round to 3. It was off to a rough start after two of us walked in 30 minutes before closing, and were discouraged from ordering in. We had to insist we'd like to order for here and eat. Two employees looked at each other and hemmed and hawed until we assured them we'd be out by close. Even then, they asked are we sure we'd be able to finish that fast? Anyway, maybe they both had a hot date . . . with each other!

Food was ordinary but not bad. We had to order kind of fast, so we ordered the first few things that caught our eye without being able to take in the whole menu. If I were in the area and needed a quick bite, I may consider coming again. With so many other choices around the area, however, I may just be giving it a pass.
author: Devashis R.

description: This place has the Chinese cooking I look for whenever we travel!! We asked about two dishes not on menu and they made them--sooo yummy!! I highly recommend this place if you're picky like me with Chinese food!
author: Christine M.

description:
Just ok.  They seem to do a huge to-go business; inturn, they don't pay much attention to the patrons in the restaurant. It's a little hole in the wall Chinese restaurant with a decent menu and average food.  I was happy to see a large selection of soups.  

The good is that it is super casual and 
quick. The bad is that the service is lacking and the food is just ok.  I would consider going there again I didn't want fast food, was dressed sloppy and needed to eat. If I wanted a great meal or great service or a nice atmosphere...  I would go elsewhere.
author: K W.

description: I was really disappointed on my food. I ordered seafood fried rice and there was mince of shrimp and slide of scallop, more than that it was no taste! I paid for $12 but the quality that I got was only white rice with some green peanuts and carrots. Sorry but no more next time
author: ZK P.

description:
For the price, the food is okay. I've tried several dishes, but the combination fried rice is the only one that's consistently good. The other dishes are just better from other places.

However, the service needs improvement. I order through Eat24 a lot, which is extremely convenient! But either the staff doesn't pay enough attention or the "Special Instructions" field that is sent to the restaurant needs to be much more prominent. The "extra spicy" instructions usually make it through (though not tonight, making the fried rice very bland), but the chopsticks and napkins almost never make it, maybe only 10% of the time. Not a big deal if you're picking up if you take the time to check, every time, but a real disappointment when ordering delivery to a hotel room where you don't have the usual tableware.
author: Wesley B.

description: Very bad experience.Not only owing to the very unauthentic food,  but also the service attitudes. The waiter figured out we are not local guys and he on purpose charged us for 7.5$ for the white rice. This is really rouge behavior.
author: Guangwei R.

description: I ordered from the Yelp app from my hotel room and walked the 3 blocks to the restaurant.  The food was packaged and ready for pick up when I arrived 10 minutes later.  Excellent service and the food was your standard Chinese takeout which was what I was expecting.  Returned to my room and unboxed.  Egg rolls were a little cold which tells me that they were under a heat lamp and not fried fresh.  Otherwise, the chicken was excellent and the fried rice was tasty.  I would order from them again.
author: Dane O.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant! I've purchased the fried rice with beef a multitude of times and it's so good and filling.
author: Kiana S.

description: I'm not a huge fan of Chinese food as I often find it too greasy and sweet, this place though, is AWESOME! The quality is good and the foods is just dome right and great. I often order for take out when I don't feel like cooking after a long day. Plus the restaurant itself is clean and has a nice vibe. Big plus it's a block away from my front door.
author: Rochelle Y.

description: Love this place. I'm from the east coast and have had trouble finding Chinese takeout similar to what we have back home(still can't find a good won ton soup though!). We originally ordered here because it was Christmas and nowhere else was open. The delivery guy was super nice and the food was awesome. Love the egg rolls(the sauce that comes with it is really good), spicy green beans, general tso's, chow mein, and rice. We've ordered from here one other time and it was still really good so this is basically my go to Chinese food spot.
author: Rosie L.

description: Food was good. Enjoyed it, however, as the reviews had said the service was a bit slow to take our order.  Food was extremely fast to come out and we were in no hurry so it didn't bother us anyway. If you like rice with your Chinese don't forget to order it separate. I would go back for sure!
author: Deb R.

description: Delivery came on time and all the food was fresh and hot.  Nothing amazing but pretty solid for Chinese delivery.
author: Alex F.

description:
Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. 

They do not care for their customers! 

They charged me $33.00 for an order I never even got! 
I called and told them this and some man who barely spoke English only told me that the kitchen is closed and that someone picked up my order already and hung up! 

What kind of business are you all running?
author: Jae P.

description:
It was okay. 
The prawns with walnuts ( my favorite) were not my favorite.
The wontons had a curious meat in them?
the rice and the general chicken were good. I'd likely order from them again only if the other restaurants are closed.
author: Jess H.

description:
We went there for a dinner after reading good reviews. But our experience says otherwise. Pretty ordinary place. Food was pathetic and service was even more. Ambiance average. 

First, as we entered, a lady greeted us and got us seated and then just went on with her own dinner without even delegating the responsibility to anyone. Another employee, who was having his dinner, handed over the menu to us after couple of minutes. For next few minutes, there was nobody attending us. The lady was having her soup, completely oblivious to what's happening around. It was another long wait before the order was taken by another guy. 

We ordered a spinach and bean curd soup and vegetable chowmein. Soup was completely bland with no fresh feeling. We had to add some salt and pepper to make it eatable but even after that we couldn't finish it. Vegetable chowmein was very greasy and poor in taste. 
I don't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Jay M.

description: Avoid this place! The people are rude and racist. I came in for a green tea. Asked the lady could I have it to go? She said yes. the guy said no we don't have green tea to go. Or green tea at all. I'm confused either you do or you don't. He then proceeded to jester me out of restaurant. And said go, we don't have it. Wtf!!!
author: Jennifer M.

description: This restaurant serves your run-of-the-mill American Chinese food.  Nothing special.  The food is average and the portions are small.  I think it only does well since it's a conveniently located neighborhood joint, and beats the walk to Chinatown for some real Chinese food.  Additionally, I think it's so unethical for the restaurant to engage in shady business practices, such as including an unauthorized tip to the bill without even letting the customer know!  The bill was sloppily scribbled in chinese characters, so at first I thought it was something I ordered, or perhaps the tax.  Then upon recalculating my food costs, I realized it was an extra 18% gratuity added on without my knowlege! Not cool. I went to the main server (an older chinese guy) to ask him about the charge, and he reluctantly gave me back my money, since I had already tipped on top of whatever was written on that bill! The food was already average, and then you add this nonsense on top of that? I won't be coming back to support this restaurant.
author: Phan ..

description:
I checked this place for the first time 
I ordered wonton soup and mongolian beef.
The wontons were tasteless
The mongolian beef had kinda bad smell...I don't know maybe the beef was old or that's the way they do it...
The service was not so friendly ... they didn't even asked if everything were good...
I left hungry and still paid even thought i had only bite and didn't even ate...
author: Sultan J.

description: During a recent visit to SF, my boyfriend placed an order with this restaurant over the phone.  The order was delivered to the hotel quickly and accurately and hot.  He enjoyed the chicken fried rice, shrimp dumpling, and mixed veggies.
author: Beatriz R.

description: After checking in late following a long flight, I decided to order delivery from City Chopsticks which was fairly close to my hotel. Delivery was pretty quick, about 30 minutes from the time I placed the order. I enjoyed my food overall. I got egg rolls, pot stickers, wonton soup, chicken & broccoli and chicken fried rice. The pot stickers were good, seemed handmade rather than from a frozen bag. The egg rolls were ok but had too many mushrooms for my tastes, I like them stuffed more with cabbage and other veggies. The mushroom taste kind of took over. The wonton soup was good except there was a lot of large pieces of either spinach or some other type of dark green leaf vegetable. They were too big to eat without a knife (which I didn't have) so they went to waste. The chicken and broccoli was good, with plenty of white meat chicken. My favorite was the chicken fried rice, it wasn't typical of Chinese take out in that they didn't drench it with soy sauce. The rice was still white and had a very nice flavor from the aromatics, salt and garlic. I would order from this restaurant again.
author: David N.

description: Service is horrible. Food is so so. Like the other reviewer said, no water refills. I had to go up and ask. Don't bother with this place. China town is further uptown if you want good Chinese.
author: Patrick B.

description: Service was lacking.. Food was just okay.. I was really excited to eat some good local Chinese food while visiting San Francisco. The Cheese wonton was pretty good, but the Hunan Tofu was just okay, the vegetable chow mein was alright,. The Singapore style Rice Noodle was actually pretty good. I would be willing to try again next time I am around.
author: Jerm M.

description:
I will it be returning.
Ordered a Thai tea with my Kung Pao chicken. 
It tasted like soap. 
After a single sip, I asked it be taken away and off my bill. 
The waitress said that's what it's supposed to taste like and ask if I wanted the owner to pay for my drink. 
I picked it up off the table, handed it to her, and asked her to take it away. 
She still charged me for a drink I did not like or want because it was garbage. 
I WILL NOT BE RETURNING.
author: Mallory R.

description:
The fastest delivery ever like it was extremely shocking lol I put in the order and like 8 minutes later maybe not even the man calls me and says he's outside lol and the food was very hot and Great. 
Curry chicken chow mien 
Sweet and sour chicken 
And only one soy sauce
author: Brooke W.

description: Food and service is okay, not the best Chinese food I've had but it's a notch higher than Panda Express. My Favorite dishes are the Green onion cake (this one is really good) , general tsuos chicken and sweet and sour pork. Place is clean and accessible, price is reasonable.
author: Karissa A.

description:
We just visit San Francisco from Manhattan and found this restaurant from the hotel. We have decided to order the foods from the hotel. 
When food got delivered, we were very disappointed due to quality of foods and contents of foods. 
Comparing food foods from Manhattan, San Francisco delivery, especially this restaurant, it is terrible, especially this restaurant.
author: Hyo Y.

description: Enjoyed my sweet n sour chicken! Fast service and I was impressed at how clean the bathroom was. Check out the bathroom when you're there! If I'm ever in the area and craving Chinese food, I will eat here again!!
author: Bryce Y.

description: not chinese! it's official there is no chinese in california. i'm sorry i'm from ny and we have authentic chinese food. and yes i've been to china and had it too. a spring roll is not an egg roll and covering food in a thin watered down sauce doesn't hide the taste of bland or poor quality. just awful and service personnel should actually like servicing the public. that is your business or get out of it. just a foodie that is picky.
author: Naomi H.

description: Great food.. very fresh!  Good to go or eat in!  This was recommended by a concierge in Chinatown on New Year's Eve!!  Friendly & fast service
author: Martha M.

description:
Quite possibly the best food I have ever eaten out of a take out carton.  

Imagine all the greatest things in the world,  wrapped up into one sweet and spicy dish of breaded and fried and sauced chicken.  

These are the things life is made of.  Hella amazing,  crazy addicting bad ass Chinese take out.
author: Marie B.

description: My favorite Chinese spot downtown. The prices and food are great!!! Best place for lunch... Although, the service could be better, as the servers always look annoyed and irritated.
author: G R.

description: Ordered some BBQ pork and chow mein with beef and it was pretty delicious. Service was quick and staff was friendly. Definitely worth a quick visit if in town.
author: George H.

description: Ordered delivery last night. Arrived in good time, but was disappointed with food temperature of two of the dishes. PROS: food was flavorful, good portions CONS: Fried rice seemed to have 'frozen diced peas and carrots' instead of fresh. They had that 'previously frozen' flavor. Food temperature, possibly due to poor delivery driver handling. Received no utensils, napkins (or fortune cookies, fyi)
author: Aaron W.

description: We were in town and wanted to get delivery for dinner. The menu options were good. We enjoyed our food and the delivery was quicker than expected. We ordered through Yelp, which worked great.
author: Sean M.

description: I have dined in at City Chopsticks a couple of times. The third time I asked for delivery. If you're hungry right now, this is a great place to order. Extremely fast delivery. I think they delivered my order to my hotel room as fast as I received my order when dining at the restaurant. It's not fancy. It's just good authentic Chinese food.
author: Ron R.

description: Becareful with the cashier. I don't know how can he calculated with 1 order of mongolian beef over rice $7.49 and chicken chowmain $8.49 but the total is $22.20. When I complain about that. Then he use the calculator show me how to count it. That 2 number 7.49+8.49 =19.89 with tax = $22.45 not 22.20 like on the bill. Is it he too smark or everybody not smark like him?????
author: Ton L.

description: our delivery order was missing an item and the restaurant refused to redeliver or refund us for the dish.  i know it's not a big dollar item, but that's poor customer service.  this was our second order here and it'll be our last.
author: Chuck C.

description:
I ordered take out from here and it was really fast, reasonably priced and the food was good. I would've given it 4 or maybe even 5 stars if I hadn't found some pieces of clay (it's red and sandy) in my General Tsuo Chicken. 
I still give 3 stars, however, because I think in general, you can't expect much in terms of sanitation with cheap Chinese restaurants.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Good for take out, really fast and hot (and salty!) always. The spicy beef noodle soup, black mushroom chicken, and shrimp with green beans are really nice. The potstickers are too doughy for my taste. Eating in the restaurant is always an underwhelming experience...definitely take it to go!
author: Anneka M.

description: These jokers made me wait 1.5 hours for food then tried to tell me they just received my order even though a time stamped receipt contradicts them. Watch out for these guys.
author: Jason K.

description:
Clean food, super fast delivery. 
The tofu spinach soup was perfect for under-the-weather recovery.
author: Julie H.

description:
Won Ton Soup was amazing! Egg rolls weren't so good. 
On a side note: I know your suppose to tip, which is no problem.
But the driver rudely demanded a tip.
author: Rachel R.

description: The best.  Always get their wonton soup and have tried a lot of other dishes.  Very consistent and a great place to go.  They are always so kind as well!
author: Angelique G.

description: Very good standard Chinese food, nice presentation of fried wonton on shredded cabbage with red sauce.
author: Richard M.

description:
I would have to argue that this place has some of the best Chinese in the city. My boyfriend and I would come here quite a lot at one point in our lives, and get take out at least four times a week. 

Reading reviews on here people are complaining about the service and ambiance in here, but the food outweighs it. It's worth a visit, and you can always take it to go and eat at the park up the hill and enjoy San Francisco. 

Their Szechuan chicken is my favorite thing, and it's probably because of the fresh veggies that come in it covered in their extra spicy sauce. It never fails me and I get it almost every time.
author: Caitlin C.

description:
This place is legit. I order delivery at least once a month, usually more. Food arrives hella fast. Everything I have gotten so far has been good. They use white meat chicken, which is awesome and what I prefer. 

Highly recommended if you're craving solid chinese take-out!
author: Ringo M.

description: Great American Chinese food! Very friendly staff! I would go back. I got the Chicken Chow Mein and my husband got the General Tsao's Chicken, and fried rice and egg rolls. All fantastic dishes!
author: Laura B.

description: Awesome service, awesome employees and awesome patrons. The food was excellent. Great place to go on a date or just something to drink.
author: Adrián R.

description:
AMAZING. 

My mother is a vegetarian and the offerings of city chopsticks were mouth watering. 

We began with hot and sour soup. Which they can make in water instead of chicken broth. It didn't lose an ounce of taste. In fact, probably the best hot and sour soup I've had. 

We then had hot and sour cabbage with vegetarian Singapore noodles. Both dishes were cooked to perfection. The hot and sour cabbage was seasoned wonderfully with a crunchy bite that was so much better than soggy vegetables that most restaurants offer. 

We topped off the meal with a tsing Tao! Perfect combination. 

Will be a regular every time I visit the Bay Area.
author: Jiten S.

description: Good food friendly staff and great prices. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for good simple Chinese food.
author: Alex N.

description: My first time here! Friendly and helpful staff made me feel welcomed even though I took forever to pick out what I wanted :) also the first time I've actually been satisfied with the quality of Chinese food! Way to go city chop sticks! Thank you for a delicious lunch! Oh! And the portions are huge! Not sure if it's really worth the price as it was just Americanized Chinese food, but it was good Americanized Chinese food and I was happy
author: Amber L.

description:
If you're looking for authentic Chinese food, this is not the place to go. If you're looking for quick better than Panda Express Chinese food, this is the place for you.

I got take out from this place and it didn't take very long for my food to be ready. 

The food itself was pretty good. I ordered salt and pepper pork chops, kung pao chicken, beef chow fun, and green onion pancakes.  The green onion pancakes were nothing to write home about- I'll probably never order them again.  The kung pao chicken was fine- its kind of hard to mess this up though. The salt and pepper pork chops weren't as crispy as I'd like and more fatty than what I'm used to but the flavor was good.  The chow fun was really good- I'd definitely get this again. 

Prices are good, food is decent but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.
author: Ashley A.

description:
Staying in a hotel for a conference, checked out Yelp and this had mixed reviews. I ordered online and the delivery was very prompt.

The best things I got were the apps - BBQ pork buns and the crab/cream cheese wontons. 

The General Tsos was ok, but not the best I ever had. 

They brought utensils and plates upon request and it was a good meal in.
author: Tracy S.

description: Given the location, quality of the food and the price, I was  going to rate this place 4 stars. However, my wife caught that they tipped themselves. We checked the menu and looked for signs that gratuities were automatically included, but couldn't find that policy anywhere. We then called one of the staff over and asked- nothing mentioned to us about being standard practice. In the end we felt that it was sneaky and underhanded and we didn't leave with a good feeling. We picked up what we left initially for a tip (we were within a dollar of what they tipped themselves) and left.
author: Ryan F.

description:
A little hole-in-the-wall Chinese place that would be easy to miss. That serves surprisingly upscale Chinese (fairly Americanized) food for a reasonable price. I'd definitely go again if I were in this neighborhood. I got the General Tsao's Chicken, which I rarely get, just because it seemed it was all people could talk about. Delicious. And perhaps part of the reason I just called this place Americanized, to be fair. I should go back and try something else to be reasonable.

It's tasty. You'll be pleasantly surprised.
author: Sean B.

description: This place is gross. Order fried rice...not even fried....tos chicken is very sweet, also got no rice with it. Egg rolls seem like they came out of a freezer. Mongolian beef is very dry...no sauce and no rice...again AND the container was only about half full. Only thing that was edible was the hot and sour soup...oh and they give you no soy sauce or sambal. Don't order.
author: Ashley B.

description: The food is ok at best, but the service is spotty and can be disrespectful.  I've been here many times over the years (they've had other servers that were nicer in the past), but after recent, inexcusable, rude experiences, I will not be back.
author: Maile N.

description: Decent General Tsao's. Orders come out quick. Not going to rock your world, but solid take-out Chinese food.
author: Loren A.

description:
My go-to chinese place, only a few blocks away. I'm a creature of habit so I've got my regulars. Favorites are the egg rolls (nom) and the chicken fried rice. OH and chicken lo mein. I'm not an insane foodie but whenever my selective friends are over and we get City Chopsticks, they rave, too!

I tend to order delivery via Eat24-- it's incredibly fast and easy.
author: Carrie A.

description: This place has such good food! We love going here. I just wish they delivered to Laurel Heights! We would order more if they delivered to our area.
author: Samantha H.

description: If I could, I would give this place negative stars. The food was ok - a little more like panda style. We ordered 3 lunch special dishes, and all were on the sweeter side. There was not much service. We had to get up to get the chili sauce and chopsticks. When the bill came, they charged us 15% tip for a party of 3...wth?? We asked about the extra charge, and the owner tried to tell us that CA law requires 15-20% tip. IT TOTALLY DOES NOT! Did he think we were that dumb?? In the end, we left no tip, and I think he called us "cheap" as we walked out. Dude, get this straight. Tip is optional and based on your service. Unbelievable...
author: Sarah P.

description:
City Chopsticks has somehow become my go-to neighborhood Chinese food place. Okay- technically, they serve Hunan/ Chinese food here. Same thing.

From dim sum to americanized chinese food like kung pao shrimp or general tso's chicken to more traditional dishes likes westlake beef soup to hunan dishes like spicy noodle soups, this place has been a diet staple since I've moved into the area.

The food is decent, and the perks are that this place is cheap and open late. Perfect for those nights when you tried to go out, but ended up staying in and all you want is take out Chinese food. 

Notes:
(+) The restaurant itself is really clean - health rating in the 90's (either 92 or 94, I can't remember specifically). 
(+) ordering is ridiculously easy (call in, place an order online via Eat24, call for delivery) and food comes out fast. 
(/) neutral on this one - the decor is pretty sterile; only a few items signaling an Asian restaurant, but other than that, pretty much just tables and chairs. Definitely not a negative, but if you are looking for an eat in date spot, this might not be it.
author: Patricia K.

description:
It was just after the lunar new year and I was craving some Chinese, as a half Chinese American, I consider it my "soul" food. I wasn't necessarily looking for that authentic experience though and City Chopsticks was exactly what I wanted: slightly Americanized Chinese food mixed with some traditional options.

I was sat promptly, given water and my server barely spoke english. To me that is a good sign. The menu was huge but I landed on few dishes. Originally I wanted some pork buns but was informed they were sold out - they must be good I thought. I ended up ordering four dishes:

Green Onion Cake - small traditional style scallion pancakes that came with peanut sauce. I would've liked more scallions, but that is a personal preference.

Potstickers - nothing life changing about these, but they were tasty and gone in less than two minutes because I ate them so fast.

Szhechuan Spicy Chicken and Veggies - This was a vegetable stir fry mixed with thin sliced chicken. It had a chili sauce that I found slightly more sweet than spicy and the dish could've used a little less sauce. I still ate it all regardless!

Crispy Sesame Beef - I'm a sucker for any Asian dish that has thin sliced fried beef. This was a huge plate of of it. The sauce itself wasn't overpoweringly sweet, but again too much of it that made some of the "crispy" beef soggy. I would probably ask for lighter sauce or sauce on the side next time.

I also got two orders of white rice which was fluffy, slightly sticky and cooked perfectly. 

It's not a large place and do not expect much in terms of ambience. I never expect much service unless I am fine dining. My water was filled as needed. While I dined I noticed them doing a considerable amount of carry out business. 

With so many Chinese options in SF I still want to discover more, but if I'm around Lower Nob I would definitely eat here again!
author: Travis B.

description: Food was decent, but I will not be coming back. The staff never came by to refill our drinks or see if we needed anything. Someone needs a refresher in customer service... Waitress was sitting down using her cellphone, not paying attention to her customers.
author: Joe S.

description:
City Chopsticks is my go-to spot for Chinese delivery. They are super fast when it comes to delivery and they have never messed up my order.

My favorites include: General Tso's chicken, chicken lettuce wraps, and the crab and cream cheese rangoons.
author: Lauren W.

description:
Ordered through yelp (Eat 24) because I was too busy to call in. I work only a block or two away from the restaurant so I left after 12 minutes of ordering to pick it up. I was immediately greeted when I got to the door and saw that my food was bagged and ready to go. The lady that helped me was very nice and as I was paying, she got the notification that my food was ready for pick up (meaning I was early) and chuckled a bit. Haha

I got the chicken with green beans lunch special (asked for spicy) which came with rice on the side. Original price on the menu was $6.45, final total after tax and bag fee was $7.11. 

Verdict: It was delicious. Or I was just starving. But pretty sure it was delicious. Everything was cooked perfectly, the green beans were still crisp. The sauce was spot on and was a wee bit on the salty side but still yummy! I loved the food and definitely plan on coming back.
author: Arleen F.

description: While the food is tasty in most of dishes, BEWARE of them adding the tip to your check. Most of us probably do not read Chinese characters so they will just add whatever amount they consider right for them as a gratuity and WON'T TELL YOU THAT. IT JUST HAPPENS THAT "THEY FORGOT TO MENTION" How convenient! I am a local neighbor who lives almost across the street and finished work late, so I came in and politely asked if they were still opened (They close at 10pm, it was 9:35 when I made it) the counter lady said yes they were open; however, they close soon meaning 10. She agreed to seat us, we ordered in less than 5' and we got our food by 9:51pm. So far so good, by 9:58 I asked for the check, when a gentleman came to pick it up I was not ready because something wasn't adding up right. I used to order the same food for delivery  or pick up very frequently so I kinda knew what the approximate amount was. When he came back bringing the itemized receipt as I requested, of course he pretended not to understand what I meant by the extra charge until the lady came by and had the audacity to admit "she thought it was better for us to pay a total w tips included" without telling us gratuity was included. I live in the city close to two decades, so I know how hard everyone in the restaurant industry work to make ends meet and I appreciate to be seated last minute (Not even); however, it is absolutely wrong to force it on costumers, specially loyal people. Not even high end places add gratuity nowadays on parties of 6 anymore. I started wondering the multiple times I ate here and they did the same thing and never realized it. What a shame!!!
author: Annel K.

description: Good food watch check they add a tip for two people and don't tell you. Just look out for extra charges
author: Glenn R.

description:
I usually order lunch here but today I was completely turned off! I ordered lunch for pick up at 2:15pm since their lunch menu ends at 3pm. I ordered a meal that is about $7 - $8. When I arrived to pick it up the price jumped to $13.30! The manager couldn't explain a reason. 

The food is good, the service is quick and the price used to be a good reason .  Not sure if this is a permanent change but make sure to ask. I prefer to have a better lunch for $13 bucks. ;) 

The sandwich and smoothie place next door is great! They have many options.
author: Cynthia G.

description: We ordered for delivery and spent $40 for a mediocre food. BBQ Pork Bun, Siomai, Salted Pork Chops and Combination Fried Rice. The Salted Pork Chop was made out of recycled pork. Looks like it has been washed, breaded and fried again. It looks and tastes funny and you can tell that it was old meat. I've eaten other dishes from other Chinese restaurants and food does not taste nor look anything like that. I called the owner and refused to help me to get my money back. He said it really tastes like that!!!  I WILL DEFINITELY NOT ORDER FROM THIS RESTAURANT!!! WASTED OUR MONEY!!
author: Arlene M.

description:
Can't even get an online order straight.

Ordered egg roll, got dumplings instead.

Ordered forks and chopsticks for 5 people, got 3 forks and NO chopsticks?

IRONIC, given the name of the restaurant.

The soup was good, otherwise the food was so/so.
author: Melissa K.

description: They did not give me any chopsticks or even a fortune cookie but it arrived in a timely fashion
author: Sandra J.

description: Everyone here is so friendly and accommodating to my food allergies. The food is great and very reasonably priced.
author: Greg B.

description: We were looking for an inexpensive eatery near our hotel.  The hotel staff recommended this place & I am glad they did. I had the Garlic Shrimp and it was delicious.  On the whole, this place was reasonably priced and the food was better than I expected.
author: LaShae B.

description: Very good with price range and taste ! got only few options for vegetarians but please make sure to include your dish request with the person and you can have something good in veg selections !
author: Bhaskara C.

description:
Just flat out tasty.

The one shot we had at a greasy meal and it sure was good. You gotta know this ain't health food when you sit down.  You're just gonna be eating halloween candy for adults when you go for walnut shrimp or the ever popular orange chicken.  Roll with it...

Greasy noodles but again quite tasty,.. that's all we were expecting and that's exactly what we got.  Yum! Black bean sauce is decent!

The kung pao chicken had a good amount of veggies by the way.  The fried rice, also had a fair amount of fresh veggies.  I repeat, don't fool yourself, this is not health food.
author: Bill C.

description: Everytime I go here the bill is always wrong, they WILL over charge you if you don't pay attention to the prices. Along with over charging you, they will include their own tip and not tell you. They don't even label the tip on the bill so you'll have no way of knowing. Their customer service is horrible, they care more about the to-go pickups rather than customers sitting in the restaurant. Be wary about your check when paying! Double check the math, always.
author: Kazu T.

description: Just ate @ City Chopsticks in SF on Bush Street... good food. Lousy or minimal service at best... I know what I ordered.... & ballpark what it cost... when I get the check, it's about $8 more than I expected... the check is written in Mandarin (?)... I asked the gentleman to explain the check to me... he got upset ... we went over the check line item by line item... the total came out to what I expected... even adding on tax ... then there was an $7.81 charge ... I asked him what that was for... he explains to me "tip"..... NOWHERE on the menu does it say that gratuity is added!... unsuspecting people would add a tip onto what the bill was ... they charged my card the total, then refunded me the $7.81... I explained to them that I was angry at their illegal practices... AND THEY DIDN'T UNDERSTAND !!!
author: Joey B.

description: Decent Chinese food. We enjoyed the Garlic String beans and the dishes on their House Specialty list, especially Orange-Flavored Beef.
author: Charles C.

description: We have been frequent guests here for about 3 years. Taking it off our list. Service staff sat down with their backs to us the entire time. We asked for change and they didn't bring any. Our meals came out about 5 minutes apart and we had to call out and ask for more water. Burger King drive thru would have given us better service. I'd only recommend carry out done in service is wanting!
author: Susan B.

description: General tsao's chicken, steamed dumplings, and salt and pepper shrimp were excellent. Hot and sour soup was pretty good too. Service was adequate and speedy.
author: Tiffani w.

description: Great for lunch. Got the Mongolian beef lunch special for 7.50. plenty of beef. Also a good amount of spice to it. Would go again the next time fresh brewed coffee is closed
author: Victor P.

description: If you are looking for a great Americanized Chinese food, this is your spot. General Taos is different then I expected but it was delicious, great broccoli beef, pork chow mien and outstanding pork buns.
author: Brian T.

description: Great hole in the wall spot in San Francisco. Came to get some cheap but good Chinese food and I was not disappointed. Had the General Tso chicken which was good and a hefty portion. Definitely coming back for more!
author: Dexter T.

description: I read all good reviews here and decided to give this place a shot. I wish I hadnt. Its been one hour from the expected delivery time and I STILL didnt receive my order. I called them two times already, but all they do is ask me to wait. Definetely will not order again from here.
author: Aidana A.

description:
We didn't want a heavy meal and City Chopsticks fit the bill. On a Tuesday night around 8pm, we were seated immediately. Great and attentive service all evening long. We had the:

      Minced Chicken Lettuce Wraps-tasty and hot with 1/2 head of iceberg lettuce

      Pork Fried Rice - good, but average
author: Rich S.

description: Best chow mein I've ever had! The service was so fast and the employees were all friendly! Definetly coming back from the veggie chow mein!!
author: Jessica M.

description: So overpriced and tiny portions. It's like paying for a full meal but only getting the leftovers. So disappointing.
author: Jane H.

description: I ordered take out from this place while traveling on business.  The food arrived earlier than I expected, steam came out of the box when I opened it so I could tell it had just been made.   The food was fresh and delicious. I ordered the spicy chicken with green beans.
author: Marilyn A.

description:
Hands down the best Chinese delivery I have gotten in the city!!!!! My buddy had a serious craving for hot and sour soup and so we went onto grubhub. The reviews for this place are totally correct! So happy we discovered this place. It is Americanized Chinese food, but who the hell cares? 

We ordered the crab rangoon, the string beans with shrimp, the chicken chow mein, the large order of the hot and sour soup, and the orange beef. By the time the delivery guy came, everything was still super hot, which is a huge plus in my book. Nothing was overly salty, the rangoons where still crunchy, the soup almost burned my tongue and tasted really good, and the orange beef was plenty orange-y. I am a total chow mein snob and I would totally order the chow mein again, in a heartbeat. 

I am known as the QOL (Queen of Leftovers) because I always order way too much food for the amount of people trying to consume it. My buddy always complains about it because he has to consume all the leftovers in the end, but I didn't hear any whining from his end this time. It was also probably because there weren't that many leftovers to begin with. Just a little chow mein and some string beans, enough for lunch the next day. 


All in all, I would totally order from this place again. Hopefully this coming Wednesday, I feel a Chinese takeout craving coming on.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
My first time in San francisco. This place is not the same as i thoughy. Really good food. Real Chinese food not the food to go in orange county.
Mongolian pork and human soup are super spicy. The kind of spicy that make you keep eating.  I can't eat much spicy but I can't stop eating.
Services is just ok
author: Nicki T.

description:
Quick family trip to SFO and on the last nite the family wants Chinese food.  

Neighborhood: City Chopsticks, on Bush Street (Lower Nob Hill) just a few blocks up the hill from all the big Union Square area hotels is smack dab in the middle of a terrific neighborhood.  

Restaurant size/ambiance: This modestly small (20 -30 people max) restaurant is super clean (94 score from County Health Dept.) and does a very brisk amount of take-out and delivery business that brings steady traffic in the front door.  Casual attire for dining in this minimally decorated storefront restaurant.  The restaurant is ok for group dining sizes from single diners to modest family numbers, but could not handle larger group numbers.  Dining with children is ok.

Food: A terrific variety of typical Hunan/Szechuan/Cantonese dishes will certainly satisfy most everybody's taste.  The Hot and Sour soup was exceptionally well prepared.  Same for dim sum appetizers.  House duck in brown sauce was perfectly crispy.  Lemon Chicken was crispy and very lemony!  Food portions were satisfactory.  Dinner with soup, appetizers, and entrees with rice, but without alcohol will average $20/person.

Beverages:  The restaurant appears to be licensed for beer/wine and has an adequate selection of all the customary beers and soft drinks.

Service:  Servers were quiet, polite, and appropriately attentive.

If you're near Union Square and want excellent Chinese food fast and without the hike over the hill into Chinatown, you can dine in, take out, or call for delivery from these guys.
author: Brian F.

description: After ordering delivery from a random Chinese restaurant, we were pleasantly surprised at the freshness and quality of this place. The Thai basil chicken was delicious, the fried rice tasty without the greasy residue you usually find with that dish, and the won ton soup was delicious as well. The delivery was fast. Would definitely recommend this place.
author: Melissa D.

description: Great spot for great tasting Chinese food. Friendly staff and cafe style dining.
author: Bruce B.

description: Stopped by while visiting. Solid reviews on Yelp. This place is jamming busy at night with To Go orders. Only a few tables for dine in, mostly customers waiting for their pickup order. I decided to dine in, and was sat promptly. Pretty extensive menu with a wide variety. I ordered Broccoli Beef, along with Beef Chow Mein and Steamed Rice. I enjoyed the Beef with Broccoli, and the steamed rice was fresh and delicious. The Chow Mein was not my favorite. Portions were generous. Overall I'd go back for the Beef and Broccoli.
author: Greg B.

description: Pretty good food, we walked in before catching a show and we didn't have to wait so that was pretty cool. The service was decent and so was the food. I would go back here if I was in the area.
author: christina a.

description: This place is one of my favorites? It's very close to where I live so it's very convenient for me to grab Chinese food on the go, I've tried tons of different plates and so far they're all good. N the service is pretty good as well, I don't really wait for long. I recommend this place to anybody looking for good Chinese food at great convenience.
author: Mariam H.

description:
We just got takeout from here and it it is super gross. We've gotten take out from here before and it's been okay, that's why we decided to order it tonight. Not making that mistake again.

Ordered mongolian beef and chicken chow mein. The beef is chewy,, tastes old and stale even. The chow mein has nothing going for it flavor-wise.

I'm giving it two stars because the people that work the register are pretty nice and would have nothing to do with decisions to order lower quality and/or use old food.
author: Greg W.

description: BEWARE!!!! I went there for dinner with a friend and when the bill came there was a mysterious $7 charge on the check. It was all written in Chinese but luckily my friend read Chinese. I asked the waitress and she said it was the tip!! I told her they weren't allowed to just add a tip. Long story short, they are ripping people off by adding a service charge without people knowing which probably means people are tipping on top of that service charge. Check the bill when it arrives!!
author: paul b.

description:
READ OTHER REVIEWS ON TAKE OUT---THIS PLACE HAS A HISTORY OF NO-SHOWS AND EXTREMELY LATE ORDERS.  

Garbage!  Liars!  I called in an order and was told 30 to 40 min. for delivery.  Over an hour later I called to see where the food was.  I was told the food was sitting there...getting cold and stale.....and that the driver would be "back soon" to deliver it to me.  WTF?!!?  No way I am going to wait another 30-60 min for cold stale food.  I told them to keep their food.  I thought I'd give this place another chance but never again.  It's literally 5 blocks from my house but I just get jacked around too much!   Try Tai Chi if you are in Nob Hill or close by.   Great food and fast service.  I called them and in less than 25 min. I had my dinner.  Trust me, avoid the hassle, disappointment and drama.  AVOID THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!
author: John B.

description:
My husband and I order to-go from here almost every time we don't feel like cooking. The food is consistently delicious, and reasonably priced (especially for the area). The service is quick, and they are always polite. I would definitely recommend eating here, I have never had a bad experience with their food, no matter what we order (which usually involves the delicious sesame beef)! 

I cannot speak for the dine-in experience, as we have only ever ordered to-go, but the food is worth a try for sure!
author: Jamie L.

description: As a first time customer I had a mixed expeience at City Chopsticks tonight - ordered the General Tso's Tofu, Eggplant House Special and an order of brown rice for pick up. While the food was pretty standard, decent but not remarkable, my food was not ready when I arrived. The employee stated on the phone 10 minutes but it actually took over 30 minutes before my order was ready (No apology either, not that I expected it). Btw, I ordered the food on a Tuesday night - the restaurant was about half full. Would I return? Hard to say, maybe, in a pinch.
author: John D.

description: A lot of food for the price. The fried rice and sweet and sour pork is the best!! Get it all the time for lunch
author: Christopher R.

description: We ordered chicken curry mild, pork wonton and it was perfect. Delivered straight to our motel room
author: Troy L.

description: This was the best Chinese food I've had in ages. Ordered the curried fried rice, sesame beef and a chicken dish which were all delicious. It was delivered exactly on time (8:42, how do they do that!) and was super hot. I'll definitely be ordering from them again.
author: gina m.

description: Great Chinese food. Take out, delivery and dine in. Restaurant is clean and service is friendly. I was just walking by, had never heard of it and so I stopped in to try it. Had the vegetable rice, chicken chow mein and Mongolian beef. Nothing bad about any of it
author: Nick U.

description:
So my friend and I were walking around during St. Paddy's Day weekend contemplating about hitting up a block party. We got to the block party and there was a HUGE line-up. So we said, "Screw it. Let's go get dinner."

For some reason, he was craving Chinese food like mad, so we walked around (and we were in Chinatown too!) and most places were dingy, full, or we just didn't feel like it.

So we headed back to Lower Nob Hill, where we live -- and about a few blocks away from us is this restaurant. So we decided to try it out!

Good choice. Good choice.

We ordered the following:
- HOT & SOUR SOUP (Large): If it's just two people - I would suggest you to get a smaller one. It was ultra good - definite recommend.
- HUNAN GENERAL TSO'S CHICKEN: Warning! It's spicy! And for some strange reason, my spicy tolerance had totally gone down, so I was struggling a bit with this -- but I have to admit, it was really good.
- SINGAPORE STYLE RICE NOODLE: Again - spicy - but it wasn't that oily (which was surprising)! Highly recommend this as well.

Glad to have found a go-to place for Chinese food in the area.
author: Joanne W.

description: Ok, hard to give out 5 stars for a place that isn't fancy and expensive, but if a low-key, casual restaurant deserves one, this certainly does.  Rarely does our family of 5 like everything they order, and tonight they did:  Wonton Soup, General Tso Chicken, Chicken Low Mein and Beef Broccoli.  Fast, nice service and quality food at a good price... 5 stars!
author: Enrique C.

description:
We placed our order almost 2hrs ago. ~1hr into our wait, we figured we'd call in to check on our food, only to discover that the listed number was busy. Hung up and tried again. Still busy. Repeat 10x. Still busy. Finally, approximately 17 calls later, a man picks up. 

I request to check on the order we placed roughly 75 minutes earlier. He asks for my street name and I tell him. "He's on his way," he says. That was over 30min ago.

I've since tried calling another 10x or so. 8 of those calls were greeted by busy signals. The 2 calls that actually rang through were greeted by a single tone voicemail. 

This is absurd. If it's going to take you over 2hrs to deliver an order to its recipient, you should not list deliveries as being available. That is called "not having the resources to service deliveries."

I can't comment on the food, since... well, I haven't received it. 

Only City Chopsticks will know if we ever will receive our order. They close in 1hr, so at the very least I would hope to receive some mediocre, cold Chinese food before that time... ~3hrs after we placed the order. Perfect, bc that's what everyone who orders cheap Chinese food online is hoping for - to wait over 3hrs for sustenance. 

Don't order from here. Just don't put yourself through the agony.

Note: this is the first Yelp review I've ever written. That is how compelled I felt to voice my discontent, since no one will pick up at City Chopsticks to listen to me complain to them.
author: Brittany C.

description:
Combination Chow Mein was delicious!
Homeboys Sweet&Sour Chicken as well. 
Great Service, would definitely come back!
author: Marko R.

description: I know they don't have many 5 star reviews but I really love this place. So far I've only had the crispy noodles (no seafood) and the garlic spinach - both were amazing. And everyone has been nice, food comes quickly.
author: Sloane D.

description:
Best in class!
I always visit this place when I'm in town. It never disappoints.
All of the dishes right amount of spiciness saltiness and sweetness makes this place a perennial favorite.
Honestly if I lived here this would be my every Sunday night indulgence.
author: Craig D.

description:
Don't order delivery.  1-2hr wait time if they show up at all.

Placed order at 8pm, called at 915pm, restaurant claimed order was on the way.  Never arrived.  I asked for refund, restaurant admitted they never started order in the first place.

Do not order from here.
author: Ralph M.

description:
In grateful contrast to my review about ABC, I had a wonderful meal at City Chopsticks.

The staff was warm and efficient, coming by to refill our water and tea a few times. The restaurant was clean, cozy (but not tiny) and had a constant flow of patrons adding to the convivial ambiance.

Their menu has a large selection entrees, 14 soups, appetizers, dim sum, and brown rice (in addition to the standard white). Beverages include beer, wine, sake, juice (apple, mango, orange), soda, and tea.

The broth of my won ton soup was flavorful and light, and the wonton and fresh spinach made for a well-rounded soup. I tried my BF's hot & sour soup which was good, although a quite peppery. The Spicy Chicken with Fresh Basil entree included green beans, onions, and bell pepper and was delicious.

Prices are reasonable and they give you a fortune cookie with your bill. I left happily full and glad to leave a good tip.

PS: Lunch Special available Monday through Friday, 11a to 3p. Depending on the entree you choose, the options are $5.95 and $6.75. Soup is for dine-in only. Here's the menu: http://www.citychopsticks.com/menu.html
author: Cathy K.

description: Decent food. Grossly underestimated delivery times. Food took more than twice the estimated time to arrive. Meatball soup seemed a bit too peppery.
author: Ashley S.

description: This place is the best Chinese food around. I have eaten there a number of times getting broccoli beef, Mongolian beef, various fried rice and chow fun. I am super picky about meat and have loved it every time here. They also have awesome crab cheese puffs. We try to eat low carb most of the time (not when eating the rice and crab cheese puffs) and they will make their entrees with no flour or corn starch but still with an a,axing flavor. Will definitely be going back.
author: Carrie V.

description: This was our first visit to City Chopsticks and the food was good. We each ordered one of the lunch specials (sweet and sour chicken and General's chicken). The portions were perfectly sized for the price. We also ordered a few appetizers. The appetizers were fresh and probably the best part of the meal. My husband didn't particularly care for the hot and sour soup that came with the lunch, but I thought it was fine. The part that has kept me from giving them a higher rating is the chicken in our lunches. It was mostly batter pieces with tiny bits of chicken inside. I would have preferred to have small chunks of chicken. Also the general's chicken wasn't spicy at all. It had the designation as being spicy and I like spicy food, but this had no kick to it. Overall, the food was good. I would definitely go back, but probably order something different.
author: Suzie K.

description: I am very disappointed with this place. With all these positive reviews I really expected better, especially that I had a 30 mins walk just to visit this place. I was the only customer for most of the time and the service was still quite slow and not attentive. I've ordered a chicken on iron pot and it was extremely bland and greasy, which sounds like American-Chinese food when someone forgets to add MSG. Don't get me wrong - I hate food with too much MSG, but I also just can't believe that all food with no MSG added must be tasteless.
author: Piotr G.

description: My friends and I have been living in SF for the past 8 years, and after a night of drinking we end up at this venue. We all love City Chopsticks! It's totally fits the bill if you are looking for reasonable Chinese food in SF. I highly recommend the Crispy noodles, and this is my staple dish when dinning here. They have several beer varieties in the front fridge. If you need exceptional service and aesthetic this isn't the place for you. But if you are looking for an average Chinese food 'hole in the wall' spot, you would be silly not to eat here. This is the best place I have found. Enjoy!
author: Lauren V.

description: Really a 3.5 star rating. I really think the bad reviews here are a little harsh. We went to the location, and ordered our food for takeout. There was maybe a 15-20 minute wait then we were on our way. Portion sizes were smaller than what we expected, but for $25 we fed two people (small woman and hungry man) with leftovers! Food wasn't mind blowing, but was good enough to satisfy a Chinese food craving. We got the Mongolian Beef, which had a nice spice kick to it. Nice good chunks of not fatty beef. The chow main I think was the best value. $7.50 for a portion easily shareable, and the chicken was cooked well. If you're nearby and want Chinese, this place is good! But i definitely wouldn't travel far to return here.
author: Kat H.

description:
This is your neighborhood Chinese place.  Nothing fancy or special.  Just your standard, run of the mill, typical menu.  That is not a bad thing.  Just don't expect anything special.  

You will get solid food at a reasonable price with good service.  What more do you want?
author: Mikal B.

description: Tried City Chopsticks while staying at the Mayflower just down the street. The Hunan Noodle Soup was wonderful, and a generous serving that was great for breakfast the next day!
author: Lori T.

description: Service is quick and outstanding, food was every bit as good as in China town, much cleaner and very pleasant staff. The pork dumplings were  very good, and the fried rice. Lemon chicken does not look at all like the picture , tasty but now "great" all in all a very pleasant experience. These people work very hard! And it is a very busy place! Try it I think you will be pleased!
author: Lynn C.

description: I've lived here for 3 years and eaten City Chopsticks basically once a week. It's delicious, everything we've ordered has been great. The Singapore noodles , general Taos, and mu shu pork in particular. Also The staff is super nice and the delivery guy is always crazy quick. Great neighborhood staple.
author: Channing S.

description: We had a GREAT meal here. The Hunan Chinese noodle soup, black pepper chicken, and egg rolls. Super cheap drinks (I knocked my beer over and it broke, sorry guys!) and it was a short walk from our accommodation (USA Hostels). The soup was seriously so good, we shared everything and it was very reasonably priced. Would recommend!
author: Janye A.

description:
I am lazy to walk down the hill for Chinese food because I dread walking back up the hill. Blah! And before City Chopsticks, the place I liked was down a few blocks. Well, City Chopsticks moves in and I hear (not 100% sure if it's true) that they are owned by the people who run my favorite place a few blocks down. Lazy Liz is happy. Lazy Liz would do a celebration dance if it didn't require so much effort. 

Since they have moved in, I have probably done take-out about 15 times. They only messed up my order once. I wasn't happy, but mistakes happen. I think I got string bean beef instead of my crispy sesame beef. Crispy sesame beef, by the way, is my favorite of their menu items. My BF only ever orders broccoli chicken, and he loves it. One of my favorite items to order from Chinese places is Walnut Prawns, and City Chopsticks' walnut prawns are okay. I have learned to ask for extra sauce because I feel that they were skimpy with the sauce in the past. I like the fact that you can order a small portion of hot and sour soup. Most places only have one size. 

So, hey. I like City Chopsticks. I am glad they are there. I'm not Chinese, so I don't have grandma's cooking to compare this to. I have not traveled in China, and experienced fine Chinese cuisine, so I can't compare it to that either. Hell, I still haven't been to hipster's paradise, Mission Chinese Food. So, what I'm trying to get at, is that I'm comparing this to every other normal Chinese place. I say give City Chopsticks a try if you're looking for some good Chinese food in the neighborhood. But if your're a tourist and you're looking for authentic Chinese food, walk 3 more blocks and wander into Chinatown. Then check Yelp again, because I have no where to refer you to, because Lazy Liz doesn't feel like walking that far for Chinese food.
author: Liz M.

description:
This is a great little spot in Lower Nob Hill. My experience has only been with their take-out so I cannot speak to their food when dining in, but this is definitely my go-to Chinese take-out spot.

I absolutely love West Lake Beef Soup. It's the soup that I grew up on with my family and I never seem to find it here in the city but have no fear! City Chopsticks is here! They have west lake beef soup which makes me oh so happy and it's exactly like the west lake beef soup I grew up with. 

Their egg rolls are fantastic too. My sister and I say that we haven't had eggs rolls in the city yet that are as good as these. Their minced chicken with lettuce wraps is just like the ones I used to have as a kid. I love that they have pan fried noodles as well. Also something that I have a hard time finding with other take out restaurants.

They do have some dishes that are Americanized in my opinion but for people like my boyfriend who love their lemon chicken, this is also a great spot. He loves their lemon chicken and sweet and sour pork. Personally, not my cup of tea, but also did not grow up eating lemon chicken. My grandmother would roll in her grave if she saw me eating that!

Love that you can order directly on their Yelp page which makes ordering one step easier and am so happy that even after I moved, I'm still in their delivery range!
author: Sabrina D.

description: Ordered the combination fried rice and shu Mai to go. Total only came out to $13 after tax and it was really good! I'll definitely be back to try other items on the menu
author: Kay C.

description:
I placed an order through GrubHub and was quoted 70 minutes for delivery. I wasn't too concerned because in the past, my orders have arrived well before that.

So you can imagine why I was frustrated when I contacted GrubHub and was told that "the restaurant does not know where the order went." Mind you, this was 130 minutes after placing the order. They didn't lose the order, THEY LOST THE FOOD! Maybe the delivery guy got hungry, but they won't know until tomorrow because HE WENT HOME.

GrubHub tried to give me some credit for my inconvenience, but as a publicly traded company, they should have better processes in place to prevent this sort of screw up.

Never ordering from City Chopsticks or GrubHub again.
author: Drew P.

description:
You don't come here for the service because it is virtually non-existent. There is a young woman who is a waitress and is rather aloof. When you're ready to order, she'll come up to your table and stare at you until you say something. She won't greet you or ask if you're ready to order, but she will stare at you. Even after you order, she makes no verbal exchange but slightly nods. Very peculiar. Maybe she's introverted, which I can understand/relate myself, but I would at least say something. There is another young man who would rather text on his cellphone rather than help you. 

Don't expect water refills because again, the wait staff are so self-absorbed into their own world they seem to forget they are even working. The food always comes out piping hot and is decent although it is expensive for the small portions you get. You can go to other Chinese restaurants in this city and get an entire meal for the price of an entree.

Despite their restaurant name, they don't give chopsticks.
author: K. E.

description: Gross. I found two hairs in my takeout dish. Now I have to go find something else for dinner, but I feel nauseous.
author: Diana C.

description:
The food was better than I expected for being in a semi-tourist area. I wanted to give it a try being that I live around the corner. It is in the range of a 3-4 star but the service was a little slow. I ordered for pickup, they told me it would take 10 minutes, but I waited over 30 minutes for my order of three items. The place itself was not busy with active patrons, but they were super busy with online orders for both delivery and pickup. I ordered the following dishes:

Garlic Shrimp
Sesame crispy beef
Kung Po Tofu

The garlic shrimp was well cooked and flavorful, but it was a little disappointing in size as well as how it was prepared. I love the silvers of garlic found in the dish that gave it a more pungent garlic taste. My togo box was only half filled. The broccoli that it came with was steamed and the shrimp was sitting on top of it. The broccoli would had been better if it was sautéed with the shrimp to gain some flavor. The flavor profile of the steamed broccoli and sautéed garlic shrimp didn't quite match. For the price, I would had expected a larger portion.

The sesame crispy beef was recommended. It was savory, but had a familiar taste of orange beef but not as spicy and pungent. I was both disappointed but surprised, I was disappointed because I could had just order orange chicken instead and I was also disappointed because it wasn't crispy, as the name suggested. 

The kung po tofu wasnt as spicy as other kung pos I have had elsewhere. The tofu was pre-fried before cooking with the other ingredients. The tofu was over-fried giving it a more chewy and tough texture. I would had liked it lightly friend for some texture, still giving it some firmness on the outside with a night crisp but keeping it soft on the inside.

Overall the place was better than mediocre but below fantastic. The portions are a little smaller than Chinatown and what I am used to getting living on the East Coast, Midwest and Sacramento. I would try this place again especially to get my Chinese food fix.
author: Vay V.

description:
Definitely agree with all the positive reviews here. City Chopsticks is a good neighborhood Chinese restaurant when you're hungry for some fresh, authentic food that's not MSG-filled.  I am Chinese, so to say I've come across a lot of this cuisine is an understatement.  Tastes a lot like the real deal from Asia and I know I can bring my parents here without them yelling at me for bringing them somewhere crappy.

Most importantly the food is clean, not greasy, looks fresh and comes super hot -- pretty sure I burned my tongue on a piece of broccoli.  People were also dining in the restaurant and it has a nice ambiance and is clean too.
author: Louise Z.

description:
I'm Chinese. So when I eat at Chinese restaurants, I tend to really judge hard on restaurants claiming to be the real deal. P.F. Chang's and Panda Express are two places that don't give you that authentic home cooked meal feel. I was in San Francisco last week and upon arrival, I was starving. I read Yelp reviews of excellent restaurants near my hostel and City Chopsticks had rave reviews.

It did not disappoint. My friend and I ordered the chicken fried rice and the black bean chow fun. It was satisfying to say the least. What I ate tasted like what my mom would cook back home. 

I'm only giving this location four stars because they brought out the fried rice only after we noticed the server forgot to bring the dish out. 

Definitely coming back here whenever I return to this lovely city.
author: Becky L.

description: Service is hella bad. Servers speak broken English which I needa keep repeating what I want. They charge 2 dollar for delivery even its just 2 blocks away from my home. Food is mediocre , not bad but the service worths only one-star. I used to be an regular but the service is somehow pretty much worse than before. Just never eat there again.
author: Melanie W.

description: Came up here for the weekend and stayed a few blocks from City Chopsticks. Definitely worth the walk!!! One of the best Chinese places ever! The shrimp with green beans is my favorite. The green beans were crunchy and shrimp was perfectly clean and done. Would definitely make a trip to SF  just for this place. Hands down delicious!
author: Zhanna D.

description: Lemon chicken was crispy and tasty.  Sauce was more sweet than the coerced but still good.  Brown rice was a bit disappointing.   There is better out there.  I got my food to go but no fortune cookie included.  Also a good thing I grabbed chopsticks because they included none in the bag.  Also no napkins.  Overall I would say very good and I would return for that chicken.
author: Jeffrey O.

description: It was a decent Chinese restaurant. This would not be my first choice to go back too. It was okay for lunch prices
author: Corey S.

description: Very clean, friendly and fast! Its been a long time since I've had really good quality Chinese.....will definitely return!!
author: Natalie P.

description: I've walked by this place so many times and at dinner time it always seems pretty busy. So I decide to get it for takeout one Tuesday night. It was ready when I got there (ordered ahead) and I live in the area...this is great! When it was time to serve, I didn't realize what hit me but my hunger just escalated.
