This place was way better than some make it sound. I'm giving it four stars -- which I think is pretty good considering I took it to go and for them that really doesn't require a lot. I can't speak to the service but I was happy with the food. Another reason is the fact that we didn't get fortune cookies. I was looking for those! We got Orange Beef (nicely flavored - medium spice), General Tso's chicken (Really good, my girlfriend enjoyed it for sure) and also fried rice and spring rolls. Both were good. The spring rolls came in 3 so we had to split one. I've seen some complaints about the fried rice. I thought it was good but some people have different expectations I guess.
author: Rick T.

description: My go to spot was not delivering this afternoon so I tried this spot. Big mistake. The Pork Fried Rice was bland and tasted odd. The Pot Stickers were small and gummy. Overall I would call this a disappointment.
author: Richard L. D.

description:
(See pics) Review #1115. Wish I liked this place more, considering there are not many Chinese eateries in the area. But for the first time I believe I had side effects of MSG (or way too much sodium), my lips went numb for a few hours.

General's chicken was a bit too sweet and Mongolian beef was not spicy. The space was nice and the service was quite friendly. I just wish I agreed and liked the food more.
author: T L.

description: General Tso's chicken is delish! Extremely fast delivery, arrived in South Beach twenty minutes after the order was placed.
author: Ankur P.

description:
This is a review of delivery from City Chopsticks,

It is easy to order via Grubhub.com.

Delivery - The order was placed at 3:33 PM.  The estimated time of delivery was 4:26 PM.  The actual delivery time was 3:55 PM.  At 22 minutes, that is about as fast as delivery can get.  There is a $2 delivery fee.  The delivery person was professional and polite.

The order minimum is relatively high ($20).

Mongolian Beef - This was a very good version of Mongolian Beef.  It was spicy.  The meat was tender.   There was a lot of beef.  The veggies were cooked properly.  They were still crisp.  The portion was generous.  I enjoyed it a lot.

http://tinyurl.com/763yn3d

General's Chicken - The flavor was good.  It did not quite have the kick of the Mongolian Beef.  However, the breading was very hard.  The chicken itself was pretty hard also.  I ate it.  It was relatively enjoyable.  But the hardness did detract.  It was all chicken though.  Lol, there was no pesky broccoli getting in the way.

http://tinyurl.com/7o5svts

Steamed Rice - The rice was cooked well.

Packing - The food was neatly packed.  The rice was packed in a traditional Chinese carryout container.  The Mongolian Beef was also in a traditional container.  The General's Chicken was stored in an easy to reseal plastic container.  There was an extra one of these (without lid) that I used for a plate.  They also included the requested two sides of hot sauce.

Prices - I thought the prices ran just slightly higher than average.  Plus, there was the $2 delivery fee.

3 Sprite
$ 3.75

3 Coke
$ 3.75

2 Steamed Rice
$ 2.50

Hunan General Tsuo's Chicken
$ 8.95

Mongolian Beef
$ 8.95

Subtotal $27.90
Tax $2.37
Delivery $2.00
Total $32.27 

Overall, the food was pretty good.  The delivery was fast and professional.  Even with the four star rating, I am not sure I would order from here again.  There are so many options for Chinese food delivery.  I am not sure they warrant the slightly higher price and the delivery fee.
author: Mark D.

description: Our go-to Chinese food take out. Full of flavor (msg? Idk? whatever it tastes good). I tend to get the broccoli chicken with an order of rice. Once it was cold, partially cooked but totally forgivable considering every other time we've gone there it's been super quick order/pick-up and consistent. Their wonton soup is my favorite under-the-weather dinner. Price is decent. Typical SF.
author: Amy C.

description:
In town for business, coming down with a cold, and a good time to test the healing powers of the wonton soup. Ordered delivery (way better to order from a local place than get room service), and since they had a minimum order, I tried a few things. 

The good: the chicken wonton soup is as delicious as other reviews have stated.  My chow fun was decent. 

The bad: for a place with "chopsticks" in the name, I was surprised that my meal didn't come with any (just a plastic fork and spoon). My scallion pancakes had none (they were just plain, with no green anywhere to be seen, but had a good chewy texture and still tasted good with soy sauce). Saddest of all was that when I opened my soup, I saw a small fly floating on top. I've been camping before, and grew up with the phrase, "extra protein," and since the soup was scalding hot, I decided there was no risk to my health and just set the fly aside. It'll probably turn out to be a deal like in that movie, "Medicine Man," where the fly is actually the key to the cure and nobody realizes it... But I'm still not going to eat it on purpose.  Sorry.
author: Poe P.

description: This is where locals go for Chinese in Union Square. The price is right and the food is good, it's not as pricey as Tian Sing (or Yank Sing) on Cyril Magnin which is a bit more touristy.There's not many Chinese restaurants near the square. The place is small but very clean. Surprised to see a Chinese restaurant on Bush and Taylor. Glad to have found this place, highly recommended it for to go or delivery.
author: K C.

description: They're fast, accurate and delicious. Dig it, eat it. They want more text but it's not necessary so the rest of this is fluff.
author: Jason W.

description:
My husband is kind of obsessed with this place, ordering from here at least twice a week. He says it's the best Chinese food he's ever had. He's also from suburban Canada. ;)

It's whitey-fied Chinese takeout, but they do it pretty well. Dishes can be hit or miss on flavor, but it's always at least fresh, and super fast (~10 min for pickup). Love their green onion pancakes.
author: Dani A. C.

description:
My Go-To Chinese spot. Simple and delicious and mainstream friendly (no shrimp heads). Fast/free delivery w/ $15 purchase. I use Eat24 a lot though and end up ordering extra food to meet the $25 minimum but also makes great leftovers.

House Crispy Noodles
Chicken w/ Broccoli & Brown Rice
Curry Chicken
Curry Lamb
Mongolian Beef

Everything is really good.  Just had Twice Cooked Pork today while not my fav was delicious.

Oh yeah $6.75 Lunch specials. Where else can you eat w/ soup & rice for that price? You also get to listen to KOIT on the radio which always chills me out.

A+
author: Heber S.

description:
I've been down with a cold for two days, and all I want is nice hot soup. City Chopsticks did not disappoint. I (over)ordered the following:

- egg rolls
- wonton soup w/chicken (NB: the one on the menu for $7.50 that only comes in one size)
- steamed rice
- spicy chicken w/basil

Delivery was fast! The wonton soup was great! Good flavorful broth, lots of spinach, dumplings and chicken. Would order again in a heartbeat. Egg rolls were good, but just typical egg rolls. Nothing amazing. By the time I got to the spicy basil chicken, I was basically just sampling. Even stuffed, though, it tasted great. The basil, garlic and hot pepper with the chicken and green beans worked pretty well.

Would definitely order again, and it's good to know there's a great neighborhood option for soup when I'm sick.
author: Dave T.

description: Great food and great prices!  Loved the chow mein and sesame chicken. Will be back again and be ordering delivery!
author: Brianne J.

description:
BOO!

Never again! Found hair in my food.

this is unfortunate because the food actually wasn't horrible. 

but i just can't...

not after that
author: Whitney S.

description: Every time I have to stay in the city for work, I order from Yelp Delivery. The last two times, I've ordered from City Chopsticks. The food is really great, plentiful, and delivery times to the JW Marriott is super fast. The pork, chicken and veggie dishes are all good. My only wish is that the curry chicken rice dish had curry sauce mixed in with the rice. Other than that, food has been stellar!
author: Bryan D.

description:
Really reliable neighborhood Chinese food with good service at a reasonable price.

8pm on a Saturday night, my daughter and I headed up the hill. (we're frequent visitors to town... and staying at the Nikko) The steady yet, relaxed stream of diners marked this as a non-hotspot neighborhood place. We're originally from New York so the "hole in the wall" feel was actually quite nice for us, especially since we're staying in Union Square, which can be a bit too touristy.

We ordered some very basic favorites and most made us happy. 
Egg rolls (as close to the kind we'd see in NYC as I've had in CA in the 10 years I've been out here), shumai dumplings (tasty but perhaps too large and dense), green onion pancake was lovely and delicate (more often that's a heavy greasy affair). 

We had eaten lunch at 4pm so we weren't starving, but we didn't want to be looking for food at 10pm... so we didn't order much else.

Combination Fried Rice, was very nice. It's the style with just a hint of soy sauce, but the rice is still white. A very good smattering of chicken, beef and about five medium sized shrimp. We really enjoyed how delicate it was.  My daughter doesn't dig spicy stuff so she'll always go for something like Chicken and Broccoli... which she did. And if we hadn't eaten lunch so late, I'd a have added one of the very wide selection of spicy dishes... 

As it stands the Chicken and Broccoli was lovely. Delicately sauced, with crisp veggies and lots of chicken.  

Other reviewers have commented that the food is not as greasy as Chinese food (especially a simple place like this) can be... and I would have to agree. We boxed up the remains and feel confident that when we go picking in a few hours... it won't be gelatinous...

We totally enjoyed it... and will return again.
author: Rosie S.

description:
I found a critter in my food! They wouldn't take back the dish.

The service is horrible. The servers can take your order but if you have any question or if they take the wrong order or if you find a bug in your food, they will NOT do anything.

DO  NOT EAT HERE!
author: Namie S.

description: We went to City Chopsticks for the won ton and found it to be a very clean, affordable place for dinner. It's on a quieter street just a flew blocks South of Market so it was relaxing to sit back and enjoy the food. The soup was excellent with a dark broth, the Mongolian Beef was very tender and super spicy, the kids enjoyed the egg rolls and potstickers too. The crab and cheese won ton was noticeably lacking in crab but cooked well. Strangely, there were not chopsticks on any table in City Chopsticks, minor detail there but it seemed odd. The service was quick and friendly and we would definitely go back again.
author: Andrew M.

description: Their wanton soup was horrible. The pork pieces in the soup were chewy and didnt taste like meat. Their fried rice hardly has any vegetables and was really bland. Never going to order from here again.
author: Cinncinatus A.

description: Got the spicy beef noodle soup. It's very good. Highly recommend it. Also the dumplings are great.
author: Bruce M.

description:
THE WAITRESS (seemingly affiliated with ownership) STOLE A 100 DOLLAR BILL 

I don't ever review on Yelp but tonight I took my friend that came to visit to City Chopsticks, since we got there the service was terrible and the staff was disrespectful. When we had to pay we went up to the cashier and had the bill split between all of us (we were a party of 5). We found out after that each bill had a tip amount already included that was never expressed to us before payment, and they even asked us for more tips. When it was my friend's turn to pay she handed the lady a 100 dollar bill (the only bill in her wallet). Once the lady grabbed the bill she immediately hid it under the register and when my friend mentioned she didn't get the correct amount of change, the lady pulled out a 20 dollar bill saying "this is what you gave me". My friend thinking she had made a mistake agreed and left. While we were walking down the street she kept on thinking about it and realized she had really given her a 100 dollar bill. We went back in there and started demanding for my friend's money back. The waitress started calling my boyfriend "baby" telling him to calm down. We kept on demanding the money back and another waitress came up and mentioned there was a camera, we demanded to take a look to the footage. They asked us to wait 20 mins to watch the footage, we started waiting but we could tell that she was expecting us to get tired and leave. After 5 mins we demanded to watch the video and the lady started saying "you won't be able to see the amount of the bill on the footage" then she asked for our phone number and when we asked what she wanted it for she had no response. We made it clear we weren't leaving without the money. Then a man came out of the kitchen and started talking to her in a different language. Then she handed us 80 dollars. Never stepping a foot back in there. And I hope no else does either, liars like them do not deserve to have a running business.
author: Mariana S.

description:
I ordered a selection of dishes for delivery, including: chicken, seafood noodles, beef and ma po tofu. All were very tasty and arrived hot (very important and often not the case) and quickly.

Would order from here again.
author: Kira G.

description:
I was almost stolen from by the cashier!!

The food was okay, but the service was horrible. When I was paying at the end, I paid with a $100 bill and the lady tried to give me change as if I had paid with a $20 (so she was stealing $80 from me). She was very rude when I told her she had made a mistake, which made me believe I was the one who was wrong, and when I didn't fight back she reminded me I still had to tip (very rudely). We left but a few steps outside I checked and checked my wallet again and I was sure the lady had not given me my money correctly, so we went back and again both ladies were very rude, talking down to us and speaking in chinese like they were making fun of us. They made a big deal about calling the cops and checking the security camera, so we agreed that they should do that so we could solve the problem. They said they would and then they left us standing there and ignoring us for about five minutes, until we complained again. They started making excuses that in the security footage the bill probably could not be distinguished, until eventually we were there long enough so the manager came out. The manager spoke in chinese with the ladies, and our group perceived that the ladies admitted to the manager they had stolen my money and the manager said to just give it back. So after a lot of fighting I finally got back my money. The lady still made a sarcastic comment when she was giving it back. I had a plane to catch right after dinner, so it was very stressful and disrespectful. The food is not worth the trouble. If I hadn't been with a group I would not have had the guts to fight with the lady who stole from me, so I hope this helps people so they're not put in that position.
author: Ana C.

description:
Great little hole in the wall Chinese restaurant. 
Not overly big seating wise. Has a large take out/delivery business (you could tell by the amount of takeout orders readied for pickup)
We were seated right away and got to the large menu to figure out what we'd like. 
We settled on combination fried rice, combination chow mien and satay chicken. 
It was a fantastic meal. 
If the young man serving us was a little more attentive. The restaurant would have earned 5 stars.
Would recommend.
author: Trevor B.

description:
I've only ordered delivery from this neighborhood spot and the food is better than most Chinese restaurants. General Tsuo's chicken is particularly good. Why the 3 stars? Because of the service. The entire container of potsticker sauce was spilled onto my potstickers. Ummm... Soppy potstickers isn't what I ordered. Oh, and my personal pet peeve, the delivery guy asked for his tip! The food was just transitioned from his hands to mine- give me a chance to tip before asking for it. How rude!

I'm going to search elsewhere for Chinese delivery from now on. Such a shame, the food is actually pretty good.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Normally I'd give a place like this 2 stars but seeing as there are so many other Chinese options (and SO many other Asian options) within a really short distance away, I'm giving this one star: just walk one block further you're sure to find a better spot.

We got BBQ Pork Bun and Green Onion Pancake as appetizers. Meh, meh.

I got Hunan something Spicy Wonton Soup and boyfriend got Spicy Beef Noodle Soup. Both his beef and my chicken were super-over-processed, paper-thin, chewy sadness. My soup was strangely sweet and my wontons did not seem homemade. Boyfriend's noodles were visibly pathetic.

When a waiter came to drop of the check, a cloud of sickly-sweet sour odor wafted with him. Boyfriend confirmed that he had just been outside smoking before walking over. I mean, I'm a smoker and that guy smelled foul. Thank god he only came by after we finished eating.

Look, bottom line, even for white people Chinese food, this place was bad. We're in San Francisco for chrissakes, you can do better than this.
author: Shawna M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place a lot more than 3 stars..

It started out good, came here with a friend one time and she ordered the vegetable stir fry, looked really good and friend really liked it.

Then came back here a couple weeks later, and ordered their chicken curry fried noodles and mushu... but oh lordy lord was everything salty! Downed so much water after that meal.  I still took the leftovers home though because I don't like to waste food.

Third time I got their soups, which were both awesome! got the chicken and corn soup and the seaweed soup.  Both really yummy, which is the reason there are 3 stars up there, because sometimes the food is good! 

I will keep on coming back to this place though, just because it's so convenient, but I do hope the food gets more consistently.. good!
author: Sh. J.

description:
I only ordered a small hot and sour soup and small brown rice. Both were fine. Brown rice just does not seem really truly brown rice. Sort of light tan rice.

For a Chinese place far from Chinatown, it was quite busy at 8:30 on a Wednesday. Great sign to me.
author: Dr. Snarkenstein Y.

description: Nice, clean and quick . The pot stickers were good and the garlic shrimp was wonderful. I must complement the mixed vegetable rice, it's tastey!. However the rest of our dinner was just ok, could have been more exciting.
author: Sarah M.

description:
We love City Chopsticks! They have amazing food, prices and service. This is our go to for take out and we recommend it to friends/family who are staying in Union Square as they deliver quickly! 

We typically get: 
- Wor Won Ton Soup, it has so much meat it's insane they don't charge more
- Potstickers, small and delicious not too greasy
- Chow Mein is delicious, noodles are perfect
- Chicken Broccoli, I like to make it spicy
author: Donna H.

description:
I went there many times, but today's experience really made me feel so uncomfortable.

In the past, the price of steamed rice for 2 persons is about $2-$3. My husband and I often go there.
Today, the serving young man is very impolite. He charged us $8 for the steamed rice, and he added the tip before we give them, which made us very unhappy.

I never have seen any restaurant added tip before we give our credit card.

Never go there again!!!!!!
author: Xiaoyu R.

description:
I love this spot! Believe it or not, its really hard to find "great" chinese food in the city.
It looks like a place, that you would not expect such AWESOME food! We have both dined in and took out home, the very first time was out of this world. However last time they were totally packed and the food was great but not as good as thr first time. And I minused a star since we ordered saki and it was piping hot!! So when we requested that it be chilled he said they didnt offer cold saki... both the hubby and I found that strange. But overall good eats for cheap! YUMMY!
author: ashley n.

description:
I have had some pretty poor experiences in China Town - San Francisco & London - but this one restored my faith in Asian food.
Simple, clean, fresh and super value with helpful and attentive staff.
A real find!!!
author: Benjamin H.

description: Was really disappointed with the order today. I went to this place a year ago and I can swear the quality of the food was so much better.  Not sure if they are getting too many orders that their kitchen can't handle or what the cause is. This time around I ordered a Black Bean Noodle and Salt and Spicy Pork. The items are over priced, small portioned, and overly sauced. Pretty much the same issue with what the other reviewers are stating. The pork was especially disappointing as they used cheap pork that had a lot of bones and little meat. Very disappointed..wouldn't be going back again. 2 stars on nostalgia.
author: Guang H.

description: I order from their Lunch Special at least once a week. My favorite? The Mongolian Beef with Steam Rice. My co-workers always order the Green Bean Chicken, Kung Pao Chicken and Sweet and Sour Pork. I always pick at their food and they're all good. Their Pineapple Fried Rice is really good too! - Luisa Wyndham Concierge.
author: Luisa O.

description: I was looking for a place with good carry out. They fit the bill. Super fast food prep. I got the Generals chicken- which was good, and the Kung Pao chicken- which could have used more heat. Fried rice was better than I can make and the portions were pretty big. Easily my go to spot when I'm in the city.
author: Mike G.

description: We have eaten here about four or five times. We typically come in and get fried rice and some lemon chicken. The last time we came we ordered the lemon chicken. The thing is when the lemon chicken showed up we thought somehow  our order had gotten confused. Because what really showed up was something that looked like sweet-and-sour chicken. It was chicken parts deep fat fried in heavy batter. And we had purchased two servings and not one piece was a chicken breast. Previously it had been a flattened chicken breast and lightly battered and very good. This is also the picture that is still on the wall as an example of what lemon chicken is. When we pointed this out that this was different than what was on the wall, she said, oh yes we've changed it it's no longer like that. So why do you still maintain a picture of a nice lemon chicken when now you're just selling something that we could've bought at panda express? So is all their food terrible? No. But I don't like the attitude, there was no offer to give us something else. There are so many other places so we will not be returning.
author: Chris L.

description: Half of the menu is definitely awesome! Can tell for sure for what I tried so far only but I keep trying new stuff here. High Quality Chinese food for this money!
author: Roman B.

description:
Great little place that I discovered while looking for a place to eat. This is simple and easy Chinese food, done well . What separates it from other places in its range is they don't make their food that greasy. 

I always order an extra dish for left over the next day , and it's one of my favorite place to get some chow.
author: Tim D.

description:
Ordered food for delivery - General T's prawns, Mongolian lamb, potstickers, and veggie chowmein.

General T's and Mongololian lamb were just average,  Potstickers tasted like the frozen ones you get at the store, and the Veggie Chowmein was soggy and way too sweet.

Not a repeat customer for sure.....
author: Bhavnak K.

description:
I have eaten Chinese food all around the globe and this was a rather pleasant surprise. The egg drop chicken corn soup was outstanding.The orange beef and broccoli shrimp were delicious.
This one was a good find
author: Brian M.

description: Food was okay and served quickly. Service was terrible considering we were the only people there. Took over 15 minutes for them to ring up a check as they were talking amongst themselves.
author: Elizabeth F.

description:
Dare I say this is the best Chinese takeout I found in SF?

Chicken stir-fry udon - tastes like the chow mein from my childhood spot in the hood
Sesame Beef - tasty, sweet, tangy, crispy, drenched in sauce
Sweet & Sour Chicken - solid

I went back the next night for chicken udon soup :) Simple and good on a cold night.

Will definitely return!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
OMG !! I totally love this place. Its close to home - so I frequent here. 
Must try : 

Map tofu, veggie chow mein (psst ask them to make it hot) , pancakes , Thai ice tea ! All this that too super duper cheap ... 

You won't spend more than $12 per person 

Service is quick and the servers are friendly.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
As a vegetarian, I always have problems with Chinese restaurants.  I used to work for one that put pork and fish in EVERYTHING!!

Not only does City Chopsticks have a vegetarian menu, but the food on it is SO SO SO good.  Every time I have General Tso's Tofu, it almost brings a tear to my eyes!  Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and the flavor is strong and fresh.  I have also had the dry braised green beans-- Also delicious!  Very rich.
The sweet and sour cabbage is really good, but I would suggest that one as a share plate.  Cabbage after cabbage is not as fun as tofu after tofu, or green beans after green beans!

They are very fast,  the food is always hot hot hot and the drinks are cold cold cold.  I love this place.
author: Alyson L.

description:
Very Bad Service!

The lady was rude and started yelling when i asked her why she charged me for the dish i returned and didn't like. She did not even care about the other customers!!!
author: Maira S.

description:
I was hesitant to order from here given that I just ate at Shanghai Bund the night before. I had walked by this small place several times back and forth from my hotel. What a pleasant surprise. The family run place had good reviews. It was also 10 pm and we were hungry so I decided to take the plunge. 

The place is small with a few tables. We ordered for delivery despite the fact we were only a block away. I guess we were feeling lazy that night. 

The food arrived within 20 minutes. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality given my low expectations.

Our order included:

General Tso Chicken - good batter and sweet tangy taste. Good portion.

Dried String Beans - great taste with a spicy kick 

Singapore Noodles - this is one of my favorite noodle dishes. The best I ever had was in Hong Kong. The noodles at City Chops was okay but not great. Definitely not one of the better ones I have had. 

If you are in the area and have a craving for Chinese, this place will suffice otherwise go to Shanghai Bund.
author: George L.

description: Ordered delivery. The order came quicker than advertised. Chicken Chow Mein and eggplant in garlic sauce were both good. Not a huge fan of the egg rolls even though they seem to be quite popular.
author: Nandita V.

description: Don't be deceived by the simple setting. Very good Chinese! A lot of vegetarian dishes too.
author: Alex G.

description:
Disappointing. Food was sub-par, they took 45 minutes to deliver when quoted 20-30 (and I live pretty close), and they didn't include any goodies! Gonna try a different place next time.

I had the Beef with Double Mushrooms, and the sauce was really thick and heavy and not what I expected at all. My fiance had Happy Family, which had a better sauce. My major issue is that the pot stickers were AWFUL! Completely dry and overcooked. How do you mess up pot stickers?

I was also a little peeved that there were no chop sticks, sauce packets, or fortune cookies in the bag. I realize fortune cookies are not an authentic Chinese dish, but I think they're pretty standard - and they were invented in San Francisco!
author: Amy G.

description: This place is excellent. Their dishes are exactly how I wanted them to be! Get their General Tsuo's chicken:)
author: Kate H.

description: Oof. Heartburn in places that I didn't even know one could get heartburn. It was almost worth it.
author: Leah F.

description: Very solid, well-prepared stir frys at this place. Healthy as well, as they don't use too much oil. Fresh ingredients. Very affordable. My go to lunch place for healthy, quality chinese food.
author: Steve Y.

description: City Chopsticks' soups are decent. Their chicken corn soup is probably the best that I've had in the city.
author: Lily X.

description: The food here is pretty good for the price they charge. The place is clean and the food waiting time is fast. Taking one star for service- servers barely speak english and are unable to answer question about the menu. The dish names in the menu do not include ingredients, so any customer trying the new food would ask about the ingredients. For example, I have no way if knowing that cashew chicken comes with zucchini, carrots, celery and peepers...Maybe a good idea to put the list of ingredients under each food item in the menu.
author: Aya J.

description: I ordered through Grubhub.. Their egg rolls had a horrible smell to it. Seems like the ingredients went bad
author: Raina C.

description: Yuck. Vegetable Kung Pao Tofu included few (overcooked) vegetables other than tofu. Fried dumplings were burnt, cold, and flavorless. Hot and sour soup was sloppily prepared. I'm generally forgiving about Chinese, but this was truly bad.
author: David D.

description:
Great food, horrible service. There three stars have nothing to do with flavour or quality of fod which were both great. If you're going to get food from this place, better get it delivered than suffer through a staff that couldn't care less if you were there or not and have no intention of trying to make your experience better. Quite the contrary.

I went there with my friend after a long Friday to grab some food and a beer. Withing the hour that we spent there, the waitress tried to push us to leave several times even though their closing time was still a long time away. She kept coming over with the check and to remind us rudely about the closing time (that was still at least half an hour away), even though we weren't close to being done with our food or drinks. Then she very subtly tried another technique by cleaning all the surroundings, sweeping the floor under our table, etc. When we finally agreed to pay the check, we were so unimpressed by service that we thought twice about leaving tip, which she didn't like and came over to attack us about it. The next minutes were a festival of flying menus, stomping feet and loud muttering/complaining. We finished our food and drinks without rush and still left before closing time. The whole scene was really pointless and very frustrating. The food is amazing though.
author: Paloma D.

description: They serve super fast!! The portion is good! My favorite is the salt and pepper pork chop!
author: Wendy K.

description: I ordered food to be delivered to my hotel around the corner from their storefront.  Food was delicious and piping hot.  It came very quickly.  I was so impressed, I was really glad I had included a generous tip when I placed the order through Yelp.  Prices were very reasonable and the portions were large.  The Sizzling Rice Soup was particularly good.
author: Sophia C.

description: Overpriced and mediocre. Also, they served mayonnaise with the Walnut Shrimp..is that a thing here in San Francisco? #Awkward
author: Molly M.

description: The people were nice but most important is the favor of the food.  Very delicious food.  I tried the sizzling rice soup and it was my favorite.
author: Lexy M.

description: First time here, great food!  Being from PA all I ever get is the big box crap Chinese food.  This stuff was great.  Small wonton noodles, quite tasty and flavorful.  I had the shrimp fried rice which was delicious also.  Generous portions, great flavors!
author: Richard H.

description:
After a long day I was in search of some inexpensive, decent food that was close to home. After a brief Yelp search, I decided to try out City Chopsticks. 
The food was pretty decent, not the best Chinese food I've ever had but certainly not the worst.
The space is also nice and clean.

We ordered: 
Appetizers: Steamed pork dumpling -  They were ehh, the meat was tasteless. It could have just been the batch we got though, not sure.
Entrees: Spicy Chicken with fresh basil - very delicious!
                Prawn & walnuts - Also very good dish
We ordered 2 side orders of rice but honestly one would have been enough for two people to share.

Overall, this place fit the bill for decent Chinese food close to home. I'll be back to try a few other things on the menu.
author: Deneka H.

description: Delivery was very impressive. Although we tipped with our online order, the delivery guy stood there expecting another tip. We ordered the Walnut Shrimp, my wife felt that it was too sour and not sweet enough. We ordered 2 appetizers, BBQ Pork Buns and Crab & Cheese Dumplings, they were both pretty good. I ordered the Crispy Sesame Beef and really enjoyed it, started off sweet and ended with a good spicy bite to it.
author: Chris N.

description:
I have ordered delivery through seamless from here once before and it was good food and a smooth experience. Last night, however, was the worst delivery experience I've ever had. 

30 mins after placing my order, the driver called me, which was great, i thought he had arrived. He was calling for directions, though, which I gave, and are pretty straightforward, yet he continued to yell at me about getting here unintelligibly for about 5 mins, until I finally hung up and hoped for the best on his arrival. He called again 5 mins later to say he had arrived, however he hadn't. After multiple frustrating calls and about 15 mins later, I got the food in hand. 

When I got back inside to my apt, though, I realized I'd been given someone else's order. Ugh. The last thing I wanted after that ordeal was to communicate with the driver again. I called the restaurant to tell them what happened and to say I didn't want my food, I just wanted a refund. I was then screamed at by the person in the restaurant who told me I needed to return the food and that I couldn't be refunded.  She then answered another call, from the driver I guess, and I had to listen to her scream at him for the mistake.  When she came back on the line, I explained that I did not want to have to speak to the driver again so I would leave the food outside my front door. She was ok with that, and I fear they were actually going to take the food to the person it was meant for.  Hope not. 

Emailed seamless about this and hope they will at least refund me for the order.
author: Denise M.

description:
You know what my fat ass needs? A Chinese mafia-run restaurant, open almost 24hrs, and next door to my apartment. 

Enter City Chopsticks. They've got delivery and take out, also allow you to order through Eat24, and take GoPago - it's fantastic. The sit-in area is a little small, but their service (delivery or take out) is so quick!

They must have some sassy chopsticks because I took a huge meal for three out of there in 15 minutes after ordering.
author: A X.

description:
Awesome Chinese food, online ordering for pickup, inexpensive, lots of options. What more can you ask for on a Friday night?

I've picked up takeout here twice now (or is it three times?) and I've had some really good food so far. There's nothing absolutely ~*spectacular*~ about it, but it's good, filling, and awesomely tasty. The service is fast and considerate.

I have two minor issues: one, not a lot of variety in the vegetarian category. I'll admit, I'm biased... places that have fake meat/seitan rate top stars from me (provided they also taste good). When the options are tofu and/or vegetables, I can deal with it, but dammit, give me some of that fake protein! Two, I ordered a Kung Po tofu dish the last time I was there and the online site gave me the option of specifying the heat. I chose mild (since I'm a wimp). If that was mild, I am *glad* I picked that instead of going with their regular. Or if it wasn't mild, booo on not making it so!  It was probably on the very edge of the heat level I can tolerate (which I will admit is very low). 

There are definitely a few more dishes they have that I'd love to try so they will definitely get my return business.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
I've been coming here since it first opened not too long ago.  I wasn't THAT impressed on my first visit, but what kept me coming back was the convenience, service and price. Fortunately, over time I've noticed a gradual progression in the quality of food and taste. This place has really gotten a lot better! (Don't get me wrong, it was decent to begin with, just much better now).
I look forward to the Lunch Specials here. Kung pao chicken is one of my favs! Loaded with veggies and chicken breast and the sauce is delicious.
author: alonzo a.

description:
Some Pot Stickers, Beef & Broccoli and Chow Mein, please... How much? Damn. 

I just moved into the city and rather than begin cooking my own food right away, I figured I'd try some local flair. City Chopsticks is right around the corner from where I am, and I like Chinese food, so, I figured, what the hell. 

Off to an okay start: I called, they pick up immediately, tell me my order will be 10 min. Then, when I asked the price, they hung up. I thought nothing of it, as they sounded busy. No way I'm stupid enough to pay $2 for delivery when I live around the corner, so I went to get it. 

Sure enough, it was waiting for me. Not sure if I should be impressed at their speed or worried...hmmm. Then, when I go to pay for those three things, it ended up being just under $30. Whoa. I thought, okay, this must be pretty good for $30. I repeated this phrase in my head as I walked home, to justify my purchase. Unfortunately, I could justify it after eating it. 

There wasn't anything necessarily bad about it, just not anything that stood out that was really good. The pot stickers were quite dry and clearly overcooked. They tasted like frozen ones they threw in a sizzling pan. Not great, but not terrible. The beef, while fine, wasn't a marvel by any means and the chow mein....eh. 

For a dinner it was okay, not great, but not revolting. It was forgettable; which, when you think about it, is more dangerous than being bad. I gave them three stars for average food taste and speed of service; but deducted two, also for average food taste, and price.
author: Joshua C.

description:
I've worked at two chinese restaurants and eaten at many more. This is the worst I've ever eaten. Like others who praised this place, the egg rolls are not greasy. They are also not cooked all of the way through (doughy in the middle). And the chow mien is not chow mien, rather it is spaghetti. Overcooked spaghetti.

BTW, I got sick the next day. But I never blame it on a place: however, I have my suspicions.

DON'T GO!!!
author: Joshua C.

description:
Unlike many of the "hole in the wall" cheap Chinese restaurants in San Francisco, City Chopsticks is clean, cheap and good!  Plus, they deliver!  

When we don't feel like cooking, this restaurant has become one of our go-to places.  Our favorites include: 

Hunan General Tsuo's Chicken (my favorite)
Lemon Chicken
Combination Chow Mein
Pork Fried Rice
Walnut Prawns

I would have given this restaurant 5 stars, but I wasn't particularly impressed with their wonton and hot & sour soups.  Both were bland.  

If you need a Chinese food fix and don't want to spend a lot of money, you must check this place out.
author: Khristine A.

description: Great Hunan Wor Wonton Soup!!!  Also ordered for a large group of 12 and they ate it all in about 5 minutes.  I'd say go for the Hunan Wor Wonton Soup it had more stuff in it that broth, fresh and tasty with really good quality ingredients.  Only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is no fortune cookies......
author: J C.

description:
I grew up in Wisconsin, eating some truly awful Chinese food.  I mean, really really bad Chinese food.  I used to think that they didn't have real meat at Chinese restaurants, as gummy and strange as it always was.  

If I'm ever feeling desperately homesick, I guess I might consider ordering from here again.

Star for how fast they got it to us.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Just what the neighborhood needed!

I live practically next door to this restaurant and while Chinatown is only about four blocks away sometimes you just don't feel like dealing with that place.

On my first visit I had the Kung Pao Chicken lunch special, $5.99 with a plate of rice included! My dish was excellent, with nice crunchy veggies and just the right amount of "heat". The dining area is also very pleasant and SQUEAKY clean which is certainly not always the case in this town.

Two minor flaws, the waiter could have been a bit more attentive and the tea they served with the meal was quite bland and tasteless.

Still, these guys serve up delicious and inexpensive food and I'm thrilled to have them close by.
author: Mike J.

description:
The place is called city chopsticks, but there are forks on the table... hahaha.  I mean I know it's just a name but...  I ordered the General Tso's chicken and it was TOTALLY overfried... like eating boulders of chicken... blah!

Also I wanted to try something new so the young waitress suggested the TAN TAN Noodles... (which were spicy as HECK but the menu doesn't say spicy either?)
When I asked the waitress she said, "oh, you gotta tell me you dont want spicy!"

I wish the ramen place hadn't left.  (sad)  This place is just another non-tastey chinese place, like the others in the city.  However the new people are very friendly so I'll give em props for that.
author: Pavle R.

description: I ordered delivery from this place last night and was disappointed to find NO FORTUNE COOKIES.
author: Mike O.

description: This place is amazing.  An absolute hidden gem.  I've never seen a place like it: every dish is brilliantly considered and perfectly executed.  There is a tremendous mind and fantastic energy behind the amazing food at this restaurant (or perhaps it is the collective energy of one very special family who appears to run it).
author: Ben H.

description: I give three stars for the food! The pot stickers weren't so great though and the services needs BIG improvement. The male waiter slid my food on the table and walked off....
author: Crystal M.

description: Love this place. The food isn't mind-blowing but it's really good for the price. If you go for the lunch special you will be well fed for 6-7 bucks (before tax+tip), and the food is quite good. Definitely no complaints here.
author: Ian S.

description:
I used to be a regular here. That was until I found several hunks of animal flesh in my vegetarian take out. As much as I loved the restaurant I will never trust them again and will never be back:-(

Great vegetarian selection.  Super friendly service.  A pleasant atmosphere, and very reasonable prices.  I will be a regular here.  I recommend the General Tso Tofu.
author: Ann S.

description:
I figured I would give it a try.  I had walked past this place several times since moving to the area & it never seemed to be crowded so, I was skeptical, but was too tired to go the 3 blocks to chinatown. 

First of all for all you crazy yelpers out there - do not use EAT24 for delivery without expecting serious compromise in your food quality!!  Every time I have tried them I get my food in 1-2 hours & it's always cold & awful!  The bottom line: if you use a 3rd party delivery service do not penalize the restaurant reviews for crappy delivery service.  Anytime they promise you food in 60minutes - you should question the ability to keep up with the demand for fresh food.  Have you tried www.taskrabbit.com/delivernow?  They are serious about delivery....eat24 is crap!

This time I opted for take-out.  I had General Tso's Tofu.  This was a pretty good option - light & flavorful.  Crispy on the outside & delicious on the inside.  

Hubby tried the Crispy sesame Beef - an excellent option.  He ate it all & was then stuffed (silly male!)

Pretty enjoyable considering the entire bill came to $22 including a $2 tip!

I will be back.
author: Stacy K.

description: Never received food, and paid for it prior as its minimum $20 to order we were ripped off
author: Davina V.

description:
I live in Honolulu.  I had dinner @ City Chopsticks.  The was very tasty and the service was wonderful.  I will be in the Bay Area for the next few weeks.  I will return..  
great vegetarian selection
author: John U.

description: Weak --- horribly disappointed. I think maybe best for a lunch crowd or something... All I'm saying is if I pay $38 for Chinese food I don't want it microwaved, I literally saw cuts in the corners of my food containers and when I opened them everything was extremely soggy like it had been microwaved .... It's sad that I know what microwaved Chinese tastes like for leftovers,  but paying 38 for something that literally tastes like it was made 2 days ago then microwaved is ridic, I don't care if I'm down town sf that's too much... General chicken = sweet and sour chicken with pizza style shaked peppers in sauce .... I don't get how this place has good reviews
author: John O.

description: Great food, large portions for the price.  Owner was great and caring.  Wish we had a take out Chinese in Miami like this.  Fast service
author: N G.

description: The shrimp noodle soup tastes amazing - spicy and filled with flavor. This place is awesome.
author: Daniel R.

description: As the current Duke, I'd feel silly giving anything less than four stars. My local spot because of location, but solid standard Chinese food, quick service, fast delivery, good cheap lunch special and  . Ironic I'm never given chopsticks at City Chopstick. As long as I live in Nob Hill I'll eat here once a week, minimally.
author: Anthony T.

description: So yummy!!!! I ordered the general tso and Singapore noodles it was amazing!! If I ever come back to San Francisco I will certainly be ordering from them again.
author: AJ T.

description: this place was is good (granted I was famished at the time though). I got some chicken fried rice and crispy sesame beef for the entry..it was bomb !!! highly recommended!!
author: Joe O.

description: Small place but cozy for a couple. Very authentic food very good tasting and service was pretty good considering how busy it was
author: AA A.

description:
wowREALLY. 4 stars?

Ordered online, food arrived timely enough (45 min) and being a block away from the restaurant. Ordered the crispy noodles and schezuan seafood. The crispy noodles were alright, but schezuan seafood which I ordered spicy was EXTREMELY sweet and bland.

The food sucks. I bet all they use are packaged sauces from chinese stores. Oh, and for $25 delivery, all I got was a flimsy plastic fork - no napkins, no soy sauce, no hot sauce, nothing.
author: ashim n.

description:
i fail to see how this place got 4 stars.  the service was fine but the food was bland, the portions are small.  there's nothing spectacular about the pricing either. 

maybe i didn't order right thing or the dishes that they're known for, but as far as the shrimp and beef goes, there was nothing impressive about them.  for $27.50, i had sizzling beef, walnut shrimp, and a thai ice tea.  the ice tea wasn't sweet, the beef wasn't tender, and the shrimp was small and kind of dry.

final verdict - if you just need a quick spot to eat, then this place will do the job.  however, if you want to actually dine and enjoy the food, then skip this spot.  there are definitely better places to go.
author: Win C.

description: Food was below average.  Scallop dish was short on scallops and long on peppers and onions.  Taste was bland.
author: M F.

description: SERIOUS craving for Chinese food and wanted to try something close and new. I ordered the Generals Chicken, Egg Rolls and braised green beans. Everything was satisfying. The green beans were really good and cooked perfectly. The chicken was okay but swimming in sauce (I've never tried it before so that may be the norm). The Egg rolls were more like Lumpia. Good, but not what I expected. This place is convenient as hell for some quick Chinese food and I will try it again. But when I have a serious craving for Chinese food, I will stick with my go-to's. I guess it just felt more like Airport/Mall Chinese food more than anything. A way more expensive version of.
author: Patrique R.

description: Very good Chinese food.  I had their General Tsuo's chicken which was very good.
author: Douglas K.

description: The best Chinese we've had in a very long time. The restaurant was less than a five minute walk from Union Square, it was clean and the food was delicious. We ordered the egg rolls and pot stickers and loved them so much we almost ordered more. The only thing that stopped us were the fantastic entrees that arrived as soon as we finished our appetizers. The General Tso's chicken was the absolute highlight, but the Szechwan chicken was a close second. If only we lived closer, we'd be regular customers!
author: Kelly A.

description: Very good Crab Ragoon and the Prices are amazing. I also had the General Tso Lunch Special and was very please. Service is nice too.
author: Holly M.

description: My fav Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood, the only reason for four stars is that you have to ask for fortune cookies when ordering out, otherwise they aren't complimentary (such a bummer!).
author: Kelly M.

description: Great food, not even a little greasy. Quality items, obviously house-made. My favorite choice for delivery, so glad they're close by.
author: andrew f.

description:
Having moved to the neighborhood 8 months and been here a few times, I guess I won't be coming back often.
The diner is clean, not like most filthy Chinese restaurants in Chinatown, which is a plus.
But food I had last two times were old and tired, the general tso chicken, It tastes like they deep fried some old leftovers again, rice and chicken plate is still good and fresh, but not great.
author: Kate C.

description:
This place was an AMAZING find. The food is cheap, and it's fantastic. The sesame beef, combo chowmein and general tsao chicken are all my top choices.

The restaurant is very clean and the service is great. If you live, or are walking close by and are looking for some take-out, order from City Chopsticks.
author: Tyler H.

description: Loved it. Had delivery two nights while staying in town in the tenderloin. Fast delivery and the food is awesome. Loved the pork fried rice!
author: Devon S.

description: Deliveries often take longer than they say, but it is always very fresh tasting and enjoyable. Also reasonable.
author: Frank H.

description: The best House Crispy Noodle combo was the meaty and savory! Totally worth the walk up hill!
author: Tee A.

description: Great takeout with online ordering through yelp. No complaints here, just solid food for the price with an ease of use factor
author: Harlan E.

description: Food was decent, but it took over 15 minutes before we got our bill. They are very busy and tend to ignore you once they've given you the food. Ordered wontons, sweet and sour shrimp over rice and beef with oyster sauce. Food not greasy, but service not great.
author: Lisa C.

description: Love the chow mein... I haven't had really good Chinese food in a long time and I wish I could just take this back with me to Southern California  great food
author: Brianna D.

description: Mmmm Chinese! I live a few blocks down the hill and order take out from them about once every other week or so. I've never been in the restaurant, but my take out experience has always been very positive!  My usual is the Spicy Basil Chicken with Jasmine rice. I've tried a couple other things too when friends have been over and we've ordered together and it's always tasted great! :)
author: Jordan M.

description:
I've order from here a number of times and have always been pleased. The menu is standard Chinese fair but the quality of food you get for what you pay is great.

Their general tsao chicken, beef and broccoli, and spicy dishes are all very good but I want to give a special shout out to their shrimp dumplings.  It is the only item I repeatedly order.
author: Cullen R.

description: Great quick Chinese! Visiting from Phoenix and this was one of the best places I have eaten at even compared to the valley.
author: Kerri S.

description: Great place to grab some good Chinese food in SF.  Had the pot stickers, shrimp fried rice, and the crispy sesame beef.  All were really good.  Food came out fast, service was friendly, and it was close to our hotel in Union Square.  We will definitely come back when whenever we're in town.
author: Frank C.

description: Combination Chow Mein was so tasty. Fast service and reasonable prices. Definitely will come again.
author: Baturay A.

description: We were looking for a quick bite for dinner near the JW Marriott and City Chopsticks was near the top on Yelp. We read thru the reviews and decided to order take out. We made the quick walk over and headed back to the hotel. I wish we would've taken the time to eat in. The food was cooked perfectly, bell peppers that still held a nice crunch. Shrimp Kung Pao is ordered to desired level of heat - medium was nice as it was hot enough to allow the flavors of the food to shine through. Pork fried rice is not ham as you might assume but it's delicious. Generals chicken was delicious too. Well worth the walk over - beats Level III by a mile.
author: Jamie S.

description:
I decided to come here because I live really close by and I was curious. 

Service was great. They greeted us with smiles and were very courteous and polite. However, the food wasn't as great as I expected it to be. The presentation of the food was pretty but the taste was rather bland. I ordered Kung Pao chicken and rice. Kung Pao chicken is supposed to be spicy but I didn't taste any spiciness at all. 

I would recommend this place if you're looking for quick and cheap Chinese food. However if you want great Chinese food, you might as well walk six more blocks to Chinatown or go to Golden Horse on Hyde.
author: Tina T.

description:
Mongolian chicken for 8 bucks, amazing.

I tried other dishes that were ok but this one won me over. Highly recommended. Lots of white meat chicken and really tasty flavor.
author: Bob S.

description: City Chopsticks is one of the best Chinese takeout spots in the city. They have a large variety of dishes, they are cheap and the food tastes pretty good for the price. They are usually fast at making items when you sit down and deliver fast as well.
author: Haris I.

description: City Chopsticks is a great place to go for a cheap dinner.  Food was pretty good and the service was very attentive and friendly.  The atmosphere was perfect for a quiet dinner.  Restaurant was very clean and we will definitely be coming back
author: Aaron C.

description: Fantastic Chinese food - fast and friendly service with many traditional dishes and excellent flavor. This was my number one lunch spot in SF for over a year and a half when I worked nearby. The prices are very reasonable (for SF especially) and they have a huge menu of options to choose from. I would highly recommend their Noodle Soup on a cold or rainy day, the Gum Bao (Kung Pow) if you like traditional and slightly spicy dishes, and the Crispy Sesame Beef if you like sweet and crispy - my vegetarian co-workers also raved about their veggie dishes! I've had Chinese food all over SF and this was one of the best places I've encountered both for Traditional and Americanized Chinese cuisine. Jen di hen hau chr!
author: Jurann M.

description: First of all amazing food, always really great and tasty! It's the third time we've ordered from here, sadly the delivery guy this time was rude and had a very bad attitude. He called from downstairs for us to come down and collect our food. We were paying in cash, and my roommate went down. He told her he didn't have enough change we gave him $40 to a $32 order. He gave us $4 change, on our $32 order and said to my roommate what do you want me to do about it? He also proceeded with he had quarters in his car but didn't make an attempt to go get them. After calling City Chopsticks the lady on the phone was more than helpful and very kind. She said she would send someone back with the rest of our change. The same delivery guy came back, we went down again and he pushed the money into my hand there was back and forth remarks from him with a very bad attitude. We realise this isn't a lot of money to ask for back, but we had already paid a generous tip and he was extremely rude.
author: Billie T.

description: Delivered early. Not greasy. Also not as flavorful as hoped. Chicken won ton soup, general tso's and Szechuan beef all good not great, but importantly not greasy. I'll do again.
author: Nick S.

description: This is my local "down-the-street" "go-to" Chinese spot. I think it's a bit pricier and nice than most Chinese places near china town. Probably because they cater to tourists in union square hotels. I can imagine it's the perfect takeout for a hotel room in SF food and I've always received good food to take back to my Bush St. apartment!
author: Krista K.

description:
Our neighborhood go to spot! Clean, good food, friendly service.
*chicken corn soup* crispy noodle*seasame beef*asparagus with spicy sauce*general cho's chicken- done...:-)
author: Tony D.

description: Good but definitely not great. I got the General Tso's chicken and chow main and both were very bland. Also we ordered for 40 min pickup through the yelp app and the food was cold by the time we got there (which means they ignored the pickup time option).
author: Kevin K.

description: This place is awesome. Always good food! It doesn't matter what you order, everything on their menu is great. The  Hunan Soup is delicious and the General Chicken is also great. Mongolian Beef is a little bit too spicy, but is good. If you are in downtown and want to eat great chinese food. This is the place to go.
author: Gaby R.

description: This is that perfect little neighborhood Chinese restaurant.  They're always super quick and make sure that you have napkins, condiments, water, hot, hot tea.  The food comes out so fast and when I call an order in (I'm a few blocks away) it's done right when I get there.  They aren't crowded...ever...which is nice for me because i can always get a table!  It might not be the best Chinese in the city, but it always satisfies my cravings.  I love the Szechuan chicken, the lemon chicken, some-other-chicken-that's-spicy-but-I-forgot-the-name, and their menu for lunch and dinner is great.  And I love that they have photos of their food...not sure why, but I always like that. :)
author: Amanda V.

description: Fast delivery food still hot. Egg rolls were hot and crunchy the walnut prawns was ok...I tasted to much mayo but still eatable. And yes I would order from them again.
author: Der Maibaum L.

description: The place is clean, food is good and prices reasonable for Chinese food.
author: N A.

description: I've have been going here for lunch every other week for the last year. It is great value. The lunch menu is around $7 for a small soup and main meal. Portions are good and the quality is good too. I would recommend it. The staff are quick and efficient, so you can pop in quickly for a sit-down lunch. Sichuan Chicken & Fresh Veggies is a good option....
author: Mark S.

description: I guess I can't say much since I only ordered fried wonton and tan tan noodle for to go. Their fried wonton was meh but the tan tan noodle was really good. I love it!
author: Laura L.

description:
I sure wish this place was still Asuka Ramen. Asuka closed so I gave the new owners a try. I ordered my appetizer and entree. I received my entree first which is a pet peeve of mine. My chow mein was dripping with grease and tasted horrible. I ate about 1/4 of my dish before I couldn't stomach any more grease. I sat there waiting for my friend to finish and before we were going to leave they brought out my appetizer. I told them I didn't want it anymore and that it should have come before my entree and not at the end of the meal. I got a rude look and they took it back to the kitchen. I paid and left only to realize later that they had charged me for the appetizer that I sent back. The restaurant that was at this location a few months ago before City Chopsticks took over had better food that cost less. 

Miss you Asuka Ramen!
author: g m.

description: I had the General Tso's Chicken. It was perfectly decent, but nothing spectacular. My recommendation is if you're walking by City Chopsticks and you get a craving for Chinese food, keep walking since Chinatown is only 5 blocks away. However, if you are REALLY hungry and just can't wait, this is a fine place to have food.
author: Andrew M.

description: Best Nob Hill Chinese - Clean, fresh and well maintained!!
author: Thomas B L.

description: Nice people but very mediocre Chinese food. The dry-braised green beans were very salty. The walnut shrimp were covered with Thousand Island or some other dressing out of a bottle. The lamb curry had that slimy flavorlessness that comes from too much cornstarch in the sauce. The mu shi pork was quite good.
author: Jeff H.

description: Food is fantastic, but the customer service could be better, counter girl was rude and didn't acknowledge customer, she just kept going through some files...
author: Adriana C.

description: Wanted to update that I got delivery from them the other night and their menu says free delivery for orders over $15. Yet I ordered $37 worth and was still charged. : ((
author: lisa v.

description: I love southpark so I had to try City Chopsticks.  Everytime someone asked me what I was eating, I'd say "CITY CHOPSTICKS!" ahahah. But to my surprise, everything was delicious. I ordered all veggie items, asparagus and three mushrooms was good!
author: Wakako U.

description: I live upstairs from this place and get food to go at least twice a week. Definitely glad to have one of the more authentic Chinese restaurants right at my doorstep. Highly recommend the Basil Chicken and Crispy Noodles!
author: Shane Z.

description: Good and cheap chinese food. Pretty reliable service
author: Mike J.

description: Very reasonable prices and better quality ingredients than most of the restaurants in China Town. Crispy Beef was a treat.
author: Beekums A.

description: just ok, too salty.
author: Xing L.

description: I've been here a few times in the past few weeks. The owner and the waiter are very nice. The food was great. I've had the BBQ pork won ton soup, egg rolls, BBQ pork appetizer.and pot stickers. The best pot stickers. I will now be coming here often. I suppose you can just call me a repeat offender.
author: Walter W.

description: great place to get a quick bite around lunchtime. great lunch specials include rice plates and soup. need to have more of a vegetarian flair on the entrees but overall not bad. 2.5/5 judochops!
author: Dustin G.

description: I really don't know why this place gets such good reviews. The crab Rangoon had no crab. The hot and sour soup was extremely bland even though I ordered it very spicy. The barbecue pork fried rice was also bland. So sad.
author: Elspeth P.

description: pretty much what you see is what you get. no complaints here. good cheap greasy fast food version of Chinese food. More appropriately---cantonese style chinese food.
author: Alex C.

description:
The service is top-notch, ordered take-out, got the food and paid within 5 minutes. Price is great too, $6.50 for a really large portion of tofu fried rice. The food is really tasty without being greasy or oily.  The tofu is deep-fried and tender and they put a lot of it in.

I highly recommend City Chopsticks and will definitely be back.
author: Mack D.

description: Good food, great service!  I don't think they're going to win any international chef competitions.  But for high quality, inexpensive Chinese food, this is the place!!
author: Briar S.

description: Food was excellent! Ordered the Steamed BBQ buns and they were amazing too. I would come back.
author: Jordan A.

description: I got vegetable fried rice to go. The food was 4 stars. The cook sitting on the sidewalk outside playing a game on his phone with his impossibly long fingernails and smoldering cigarette was 0 stars. 2 stars is a happy medium. I won't go back.
author: H P.

description:
The General Tso chicken was good. Crispy, good sauce, and quality meat. However that's where the joy fades. The hot and sour soup was ordered spicy and it was only a five on the hot scale out of ten. Kinda grey, vegetarian, not that I mind vegetarian but I prefer traditional, but it was not listed as such, and too much corn starch. The potstickers were an embarrassment. They were actually gyoza, thin skin and small. The meat was hard and made me think they were twice fried.Made me think they were left over from the lunch shift. Very disappointing. The dan dan was mild and okay but the noodles weren't handling the trip well. They were a little blobby and over cooked. It was delivery so I was expecting flaccid noodles but these were really kinda impotent. The leftovers turned into one mass of gravy starch. I'm a dan dan man and have had them done properly, so these were a bummer. Three out of ten. The hot and sour beef was more like a fair szechuan beef. Not tangy and not hot. A five, maybe six, nothing too hot. 
It was delivered hot and on time. They forgot the hoisin for our mu-shi. I was out of hoisin for once and they dropped a single container by,  after we called but we were done eating by then. The mu-shi pork was lackluster, wet, flavorless and unremarkable.
The General Tso was good, but not enough to bring us back to this restaurant anytime soon.  
In a town that is finally breaking the Cantonese/American barrier this was a step backwards. Good luck!
author: Edward C.

description:
City Chopsticks = my new go-to for Chinese.
I recommend the hot & sour soup and the shrimp with broccoli.
They offer brown rice.
They're super friendly and quick! 
Typically eat here once, maybe twice a week.
author: Vic E.

description: We came in from out of town late n just wanted some good Chinese food delivered! i read the reviews n they sounded good ordered some pork chow mien, vegetable fried rice n orange chicken with some pork dumplings!! The vegetable rice was not fried rice it was white rice with vegetables, not what we ordered! But it was good, The chow mien was bland n cold the dumplings where full of flavor but cold n the  orange chicken was flavorful but kind of cold so no I will not recommend this place again!!
author: Pete C.

description: I love this place. Close to my apartment and service is always fast and friendly. I think my gf and I have been coming here too often because the lady now knows us by what we order haha. But all laughs aside, its nice to grab a couple plates of chinese food and rice for two under 30 dollars.
author: Nic P.

description: Super solid -- inexpensive, friendly, and tasty. General Tso's is crispy with a perfect sauce. Recommend!
author: Misha S.

description: Good Chinese takeout that does not lead to a great gut-bomb that many takeout places do. I grab food here frequently when I don't feel like cooking. My favorite is the black bean sauce
author: Laura D.

description: Totally delicious/light CHinese Food. Such a great neighborhood spot for Nob Hill residents or for delivery!
author: Corey R.

description: Combination chow mein, sweet and sour chicken, and garlic chicken.  All very pleasant and a relief to sit down for a late lunch, value for the price and freshly cooked.
author: Heather C.

description: It has been 2 hours.  I don't have my Chinese food.  The line is busy.
author: Val V.

description:
I am giving them 4 stars because they are in the neighborhood that lacks a close good delivery place.
Good Chow Mein, shrimp dumplings, and pot stickers. Nice people. Don't expect a super chinese experience but in general a good experience if you live nearby
author: Susan M.

description: used to come in here for the pot stickers every other day, this place has a nice little charm to it and the staff is very friendly, would highly  recommend!
author: Mike P.

description: They took exactly as long as they told us to deliver, 30 minutes. The crispy beef was great, the won ton soup was very good and the broccoli shrimp OK. I would order here again. Of course we are from an area where there is not great Asian and I have a feeling that many of the reviewers are a bit spoiled here in SF.
author: Irene B.

description: Very good chow mien and generals chicken.  Very good portions except for the Mango Shrimp where it was lost in mango and vegetables.
author: Travis S.

description:
I went here for lunch today, never again.  The service was terribly slow and there were only 2 other tables in the restaurant.  The waiter gave me some lukewarm tea that was almost water then disappeared for about 10 minutes.  He never returned with the water I requested.   One table had to go to the counter to pay because they could not find the waiter to request the check.  I ordered an appetizer  (temprura fried prawns with jalepenos) and the chicken curry lunch.  The soup, tempura fried prawns sans jalepenos and chicken curry all arrived at the same time.  When I told the waiter the appetizer was incorrect, he sent out the owner/hostess who argued with me, apparently not understanding that if an appy states an ingredient, the ingredient should be included.  

The hot and sour soup was delicious and the curry was okay.  I may go back for take out, but service in that establishment is abysmal.
author: Fern H.

description: I walked over from the Grand Hyatt a few weeks ago. It's a good workout, especially walking up a massive hilly street! It was so good, that I went 2 days in a row. The first day, I ordered the veggie Kung pao lunch special and it was SO good!! The young gal that waited on me was so sweet. The portion was huge & after the soup (that comes with the lunch special) I couldn't finish it & packed it to go. The second visit wasn't as good. A semi-spacey guy waited on me. I ordered the garlic eggplant for appetizer & the veggie chow fun. I received the appetizer after the chow fun! The garlic eggplant was gross & had no flavor. It looked like tempura & there was no hint of garlic in that dish. The chow fun was less than average. If you're a vegetarian, try the Kung pao veggies, you won't be sorry!
author: L P.

description: I used to work for a restaurant and I highly dislike saying the truth behind how horrible and how much of a SCAM AND RIP OFF this place is. I order an entree and two appetizers and a sprite. The total sounded rather high 41. but I was pleased at the overwhelming good reviews which half were probably written by the friends of the owners. They delivery really fast, about 30 minutes to a nice 5 star hotel. I her the knock at the door and hand the money and get the food. As I ask for the bill which was still in his hand and seemed reluctant to hand it over. He eventually did as soon as he gave it to me and my head was down looking at it as the cleaning lady was in my room straightening up I noticed and was alarmed how it was ONLY 32 dollars. I always feel like you should tip so I gave that guy 45 dollars. They made an extra $13 off of me. Food was decent BUT NEVER RECOMMENDED . When the cleaning lady was in there she asked and noticed how I got swindled and said she can call the doorman or bellhop or someone to stop him since it was uncalled for. I feel like it is unnecessary since what goes around comes around. I called to inform them and this guy picked up then switched the phone over to a girl. I told them to at least give me 5 dollars back just for the principal not for the money aspect. They said no and they did not rip me off but this receipt wouldn't lie. Unless you feel like getting scammed their are way too many chinese restaurants. I highly recommend yum yums. Fast quick and ten times better :)
author: Jen L.

description: We dropped by this family-owned and operated Chinese restaurant on its opening day. The extensive menu features a wide variety of Hunan and Mandarin-style dishes. The egg rolls are fresh, delicious, not too greasy or filling and make a wonderful start to the meal. Sui mai is delicious and satisfying, The walnut prawns were great as they were lightly battered and not overwhelmed by the sauce. Finally, the ma pau tofu was served in large portions in a sauce that was spicy, but not overpowering. If I have to sum up their cooking style in one word, it would have to be "balance". As I mentioned before, the staff is composed of the family proprietors who are going out of their way to not just run a business, but be good neighbors as well. You can dine in or take out. I plan to visit here many times in the future.
author: Randy S.

description: First time trying after boycotting Tai Chi. Great food, quick delivery and will go back again. The spicy beef noodle soup is amazing, general tsos tofu and beef fried rice are also awesome. Give them a try. You won't be let down.
author: R W.

description: At first I was pretty cautious about venturing to this place because it seemed like many of the restaurants that had been in this location were subpar at best, but after a few months past it's opening my boyfriend & decided to try it due to extreme laziness (its right down the street from where we live).  We have been going back weekly ever since.  It's simply GOOD Chinese food!  We love the chicken fried rice, crispy sesame beef and recently the chicken with green beans. And we've never been disappointed!  The prices aren't that great considering that one could get the same stuff for cheaper many more blocks away in Chinatown but the convenience is worth it. That and it's always tasty and the portions are decent. The staff seem nice but there's not much to write about there. It's definitely a place I'd recommend to anyone who wants to know if there's a decent Chinese joint in Lower Nob Hill!
author: Nix B.

description: Every time I'm incredibly hungover(every sunday), nothing says a pick me up like crispy sesame beef and chow mein! My go-to for quick and delicious food fast! Very friendly staff also even though I've only done takeout.
author: Alex F.

description: My mom and I wanted to have Chinese on Christmas Eve after shopping downtown and found city chopsticks. We shared potstickers, vegetable chow mein and chicken with green beans and enjoyed all 3 items. Very fresh flavor and decent price. I'd go back if I was in the area.
author: Alexa S.

description: Awesome food and service. Very friendly staff, great prices and laid-back, casual atmosphere.
author: Tim H.

description: I was taking a seminar in SF and didn't want to walk too far from my hotel.  Checked Yelp and found City Chopsticks.  I went for an early dinner and the service was great, food is fresh.  Chow Mein had all white meat chicken, not like the usual mystery pieces you get with chow mein.  Very good prices, especially for the City.
author: Nancy B.

description: Cheap and decent. This is like the Tendernob version of King Dong/Taiwan Restaurant over in Berkeley. Had the Beef Tofu over rice, delish.
author: Charlie T.

description: This place does not look very enticing for some reason but once i tried it I went back for more.  Food was tasty, portions were decent; and service was fast. So far I really like the asparagus with mushrooms and mixed veggies. This may be my go-to for dinner after work.
author: Arleen M.

description: Is it the best Chinese food? Not by a longshot --the food rates a 3 at best. But the hours are great, the prices are cheap, you can get an order to go in less than 15 minutes and the people are nice. As long as you know which dishes to avoide and don't have too high expectations, it's a great little place.
author: Cherie D.

description: I have no idea what restaurant the previous reviewers went to, but my experience was exactly opposite. I live in the neighborhood so I really wanted to like this place, especially since their other restaurant, King Ling on Geary is my go to place for Chinese take-out. The restaurant itself is quiet nice for in-dinning, but the food is very bland. So far I have only ordered the BBQ pork fried rice (which I was really looking forward to), spicy salt and pepper shrimp, and black pepper chicken. The shrimp and chicken were mediocre at best, but the BBQ pork fried rice was the worst I've ever had. It's like they cooked the rice and threw some pieces of BBQ pork and vegetables on top. I think I will go back to King Ling for my Chinese take-outs, especially when their food is better at a cheaper price, and the menu is pretty much the same. I believe there was a Ramen noodle place here before, and they didn't last too long. If City Chopsticks is going to be a success in this neighborhood, they better step up their game!
author: Duncan M.

description: wasn't too excited about another chinese restaurant moving into the neighborhood especially as there have been some interesting new openings nearby and some about to happen.  did try the kung pao chicken and enjoyed it - chicken was fresh and vegetables tasty with the right amount of heat.   the place itself is nicely painted and clean.  the sign outside is at odds with the place as it's garish looking.
author: Joan M.
